Why Go?
为什么要去？

Ancient walled capital turned sprawling megacity, Beijing (Běijīng, 北京), remains the central stronghold of Chinese power. Ghosts of emperors past haunt the Forbidden City, tourists trail past Mao in his Tian’anmen Sq mausoleum, while the current crop of cadres run the show from their lakeside HQ at Zhongnanhai.
北京（Běijīng， 北京 ）是古老的围墙首都，变成了庞大的特大城市，仍然是中国权力的中心据点。过去皇帝的鬼魂出没于紫禁城，游客在天安门广场陵墓中从毛身边走过，而现在的干部则在他们位于中南海的湖畔总部主持演出。

A uniquely micromanaged metropolis, Beijing today is the control room for the ‘Chinese Dream’ of great rejuvenation. Yet it’s also China’s richest repository of historic and cultural attractions. Multiple Unesco World Heritage Sites, temples, altars, palaces and socialist monuments jostle for space with skyscrapers, ring roads and mega-malls.
北京是一个独特的微观管理大都市，今天是伟大复兴的“中国梦”的控制室。然而，它也是中国最丰富的历史和文化景点宝库。多个联合国教科文组织世界遗产、寺庙、祭坛、宫殿和社会主义纪念碑与摩天大楼、环路和大型购物中心争夺空间。

If that all sounds a bit overwhelming, you can still tune out amid historic hutong (alleyways), alongside willow-lined lakes, in divey music clubs and avant-garde art galleries, or out on the Great Wall, draped dreamily across Beijing’s northern mountains.
如果这一切听起来有点让人不知所措，你仍然可以在历史悠久的胡同 （小巷）中，在柳树成荫的湖边，在潜水音乐俱乐部和前卫艺术画廊中，或者在梦幻般地覆盖在北京北部山区的长城上。

何时去

4 月下旬至 6 月上旬天气晴朗，游客较少。

九月最好的月份，在十月假期成群结队之前。

Dec From hot chestnuts to ice-skating, Beijing wears its winter coat well.
12 月从热栗子到滑冰，北京都穿好了冬衣。

Beijing Highlights
北京亮点

1 Forbidden City Exploring the secretive world of 24 emperors.
1 紫禁城探索 24 位皇帝的秘密世界。

2 Temple of Heaven Communicating with the gods at China’s most sacred imperial altar.
2 天坛 在中国最神圣的皇家祭坛上与神灵交流。

3 Summer Palace Walking the impossibly ornate Long Corridor, before clambering up Longevity Hill for the grand view.
3 颐和园 漫步在华丽得不可思议的长廊上，然后爬上长寿山欣赏壮丽的景色。

4 798 Art District Gallery-hopping in Asia’s finest contemporary-art cluster, set within a model communist factory complex.
4 798 艺术区画廊 - 在亚洲最好的当代艺术集群中跳跃，坐落在一个模范的共产主义工厂群内。

5 Jingshan Park Clambering up to the Pavilion of Ten Thousands Springs for one of the finest views in China.
5 景山公园爬上万泉亭，欣赏中国最美的景色之一。

6 Lama Temple Gazing in wonder at the 18m-tall Buddha carved from a single trunk of Tibetan sandalwood.
6 雍和宫 惊奇地凝视着由一根藏檀树干雕刻而成的 18 米高的佛像。

7 Drum & Bell Towers Standing in the square that connects this mighty edifice to its compatriot the Bell Tower.
7 鼓楼和钟楼 站在连接这座宏伟建筑和其同胞钟楼的广场上。

8 Tian’anmen Square Seeing the five-starred Red Flag raised or lowered by goose-stepping soldiers under the stony gaze of Mao Zedong (in portrait form).
8 天安门广场在毛泽东石头般的注视下，看到鹅步军人升起或降下的五星红旗（肖像）。

History
历史

Although it seems it has presided over China since time immemorial, Beijing (literally, ‘Northern Capital’) – positioned outside the central heartland of Chinese civilisation – only emerged as a cultural and political force that would shape the destiny of China with the 13th-century Mongol occupation of China.
尽管北京（字面意思是“北方首都”）似乎自古以来就主宰着中国，但位于中华文明中心地带之外的北京（字面意思是“北方首都”）只是随着 13 世纪蒙古对中国的占领而成为塑造中国命运的文化和政治力量。

Chinese historical sources identify the earliest settlements from 1045 BC. In later centuries Beijing was successively occupied by foreign forces: it was established as an auxiliary capital under the Khitan, nomadic Mongolic people who formed China’s Liao dynasty (AD 907–1125). Later the Jurchens, Tungusic people originally from the Siberian region, turned the city into their Jin dynasty capital (1115–1234), during which time it was enclosed within fortified walls, accessed by eight gates.
中国史料确定了公元前 1045 年最早的定居点。在后来的几个世纪里，北京相继被外国势力占领：它是契丹的辅助首都，契丹是游牧蒙古民族，形成了中国的辽朝（公元 907-1125 年）。后来，来自西伯利亚地区的通古斯人女真人将这座城市变成了他们的金朝首都（1115-1234 年），在此期间，它被围在坚固的城墙内，由八个城门进入。

But in 1215 the army of the great Mongol warrior Genghis Khan razed Beijing, an event that was paradoxically to mark the city’s transformation into a powerful national capital. Apart from the first 53 years of the Ming dynasty and 21 years of Nationalist rule in the 20th century, it has enjoyed this status to the present day.
但在 1215 年，伟大的蒙古战士成吉思汗的军队夷平了北京，这一事件自相矛盾地标志着这座城市转变为强大的国家首都。除了明朝的前53年和20世纪的国民党统治的21年之外，它一直享有这一地位至今。

The city came to be called Dàdū (大都; Great Capital), also assuming the Mongol name Khanbalik (the Khan’s town). By 1279, under the rule of Kublai Khan, grandson of Genghis Khan, Dàdū was the capital of the largest empire the world has ever known.
这座城市后来被称为大都（ 大都 ;大都），也采用蒙古语名称 Khanbalik（可汗的城镇）。到 1279 年，在成吉思汗的孙子忽必烈的统治下，大都已成为世界上有史以来最大的帝国的首都。

The basic grid of present-day Beijing was laid during the Ming dynasty, and Emperor Yongle (r 1403–24) is credited with being the true architect of the modern city. Much of Beijing’s grandest architecture, such as the Forbidden City and the iconic Hall of Prayer for Good Harvests in the Temple of Heaven Park, date from his reign.
当今北京的基本网格是在明代奠定的，永乐皇帝（1403-24 年在位）被认为是现代城市的真正建筑师。北京大部分最宏伟的建筑，如紫禁城和天坛公园标志性的祈福殿，都可以追溯到他的统治时期。

The Manchus, who invaded China in the 17th century to establish the Qing dynasty, essentially preserved Beijing’s form. In the last 120 years of the Qing dynasty, though, Beijing was subjected to power struggles, invasions and ensuing chaos. The list is long: Anglo-French troops, who in 1860 burnt the Old Summer Palace to the ground; the corrupt regime of Empress Dowager Cixi; the catastrophic Boxer Rebellion; the Japanese occupation of 1937; and the Nationalists. Each and every period left its indelible mark, although the shape and symmetry of Beijing was maintained.
满族人在 17 世纪入侵中国建立清朝，基本上保留了北京的形式。然而，在清朝的最后 120 年里，北京饱受权力斗争、入侵和随之而来的混乱。名单很长：英法军队，他们在 1860 年将圆明园夷为平地;慈禧太后的腐败政权;灾难性的义和团运动;1937 年的日本占领;和国民党。每个时期都留下了不可磨灭的印记，尽管北京的形状和对称性得以保留。

Modern Beijing came of age when, in January 1949, the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) entered the city. On 1 October of that year Mao Zedong proclaimed a ‘People’s Republic’ from the Gate of Heavenly Peace to an audience of some 500,000 citizens.
1949 年 1 月，中国人民解放军 （PLA） 进入这座城市，现代北京已经成熟。同年 10 月 1 日，毛泽东在天安之门向约 50 万市民宣布成立“人民共和国”。

Like the emperors before them, the communists significantly altered the face of Beijing. The páilóu (decorative archways) were destroyed and city blocks pulverised to widen major boulevards. The city’s magnificent outer walls were levelled in the interests of traffic circulation. Soviet experts and technicians poured in, bringing their own Stalinesque touches.
与他们之前的皇帝一样，共产党人极大地改变了北京的面貌。páilóu（装饰拱门）被摧毁，城市街区被粉碎以拓宽主要林荫大道。为了交通流通，城市宏伟的外墙被夷为平地。苏联专家和技术人员纷至沓来，带来了他们自己的斯大林式风格。

The past three decades have finalised Beijing’s century-long transformation from an ancient walled capital into a showpiece megacity, with towering skyscrapers, vast shopping malls and the world’s secondlargest subway system (behind Shanghai). In the process, Beijing has shed whole neighbourhoods of hutong alleyways and transformed (in some areas) beyond recognition.
过去三十年，北京从一个古老的围墙首都变成了一个展示性的特大城市，拥有高耸的摩天大楼、巨大的购物中心和仅次于上海的世界第二大地铁系统。在这个过程中，北京已经摆脱了整个衚衕巷，并（在某些地区）变得面目全非。

And yet, a counter-narrative to Beijing’s woeful record of heritage preservation is that once off-limits slices of the old capital are being restored and opened to the public for the first time. From unseen nooks of the Forbidden City to former temples and guildhalls, arguably there’s more for the average tourist to see today than at any time in the past. Which, naturally, is all the more reason to put Beijing at the very top of your itinerary.
然而，与北京在遗产保护方面的悲惨记录相反的说法是，曾经禁止进入的旧首都的一部分正在修复并首次向公众开放。从紫禁城看不见的角落到以前的寺庙和市政厅，可以说，今天普通游客可以看到的东西比过去任何时候都多。这自然是将北京放在您行程中首位的理由。

1Sights
1 景点

Beijing is inseparable from the Forbidden City, the vast and secretive palace complex at the dead centre of a compass-perfect cityscape conceived by Ming emperor Yongle, the great builder. Remarkably, central Beijing retains its historic, low-slung layout, a fantastical masterwork of feng shui and divine order, where you’ll find most of the major historic sights. For a grand overview, clamber up Jingshan Park and drink it all in.
北京与紫禁城密不可分，紫禁城是一座巨大而隐秘的宫殿建筑群，位于明朝永乐皇帝构思的指南针般完美的城市景观的中心。值得注意的是，北京市中心保留了其历史悠久的低矮布局，这是风水和神圣秩序的奇幻杰作，您可以在这里找到大部分主要的历史景点。如果想欣赏一下宏伟的景色，可以爬上景山公园 ，尽情享受。

紫禁城

1Forbidden City & Dongcheng Central
1 故宫和东城中心

oForbidden CityHISTORIC SITE
o 紫禁城历史遗址

(紫禁城, Zǐjìn Chéng; map Google map; %010 8500 7114; www.dpm.org.cn; Nov-Mar ¥40, Apr-Oct ¥60, Clock Exhibition Hall ¥10, Hall of Jewellery ¥10, audio guide ¥40; h8.30am-5pm Apr-Oct, to 4.30pm Nov-Mar, last entry 1hr prior to closing, closed Mon; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen West, exit B, or Tian’anmen East, exit A)
（ 紫禁城 ，Zǐjìn Chéng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 8500 7114;www.dpm.org.cn;11-3 月 40 日元，4 月-10 月 60 日元，钟表展厅 10 日元，珠宝馆 10 日元，语音导览 40 日元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 8 时 30 分至下午 5 时，11 月至 3 月下午 4 时 30 分，最后入场时间为闭馆前 1 小时，周一闭馆; b 1 号线至天安门西 B 出口，或天安门东 A 出口）

Enclosed by 3.5km of citadel walls at the very heart of Beijing, the Unescolisted Forbidden City is China’s largest and best-preserved collection of ancient buildings – large enough to comfortably absorb the 16 million visitors it receives each year. Steeped in stultifying ritual, this otherworldly palace was the reclusive home to two dynasties of imperial rule, sharing 900-plus buildings with a retinue of eunuchs, servants and concubines, until the Republic overthrew the last Qing emperor in 1911.
紫禁城位于北京市中心，被3.5公里长的城堡围墙包围，是中国规模最大、保存最完好的古建筑群，其规模足以容纳每年接待的1600万游客。这座超凡脱俗的宫殿沉浸在令人陶醉的仪式中，是两个帝国统治王朝的隐居地，与宦官、仆人和妃嫔的随从共享 900 多座建筑，直到 1911 年共和国推翻了清朝末代皇帝。

The year 2020 marks the 600th anniversary of the Forbidden City, which the palace intends to celebrate by ensuring more of the complex is open for visitors than at any other time in its history as a tourist attraction. Which is a longer history than you might think – the Palace Museum (故宫博物馆, Gùgōng Bówùguǎn), as the Forbidden City is officially called, first opened in 1925, just one year after Puyi, the abdicated ‘last emperor’, was evicted from the Inner Court.
2020 年是紫禁城成立 600 周年，紫禁城打算通过确保紫禁城向游客开放的建筑群比其作为旅游景点历史上任何时候都多来庆祝这一年。故宫博物院的历史比你想象的要长——故宫博物馆（故宫博物馆，故宫博物馆 ，故宫博物馆），紫禁城的正式名称，于 1925 年首次开放，就在退位的“末代皇帝”溥仪被逐出内廷一年后。

Built between 1406 and 1420 by the Ming emperor Yongle, the construction of the Forbidden City was a titanic undertaking, employing battalions of labourers and craftspeople. Pillars of precious nanmu wood were floated from the jungles of southwest China to the capital, while blocks of quarried stone were hauled to the palace in winter over ingenious ice roads. Once built, the Forbidden City was governed by a stultifying code of rules, protocol and superstition; 24 emperors of the Ming and Qing dynasties governed China from its closed-off world, often erratically and haphazardly, until revolution swept them all away just a century ago. Despite its age, most of the buildings you see are post-18th-century Qing dynasty constructions and renovations – fire was a constant hazard, hence the enormous brass water vats everywhere.
紫禁城由明朝永乐皇帝于 1406 年至 1420 年间建造，是一项艰巨的工程，雇用了成群结队的工人和工匠。珍贵的楠木柱从中国西南部的丛林中飘到京城，而开采的石块则在冬天通过巧妙的冰路被拖到宫殿。紫禁城建成后，受到规则、礼仪和迷信的令人震惊的准则的约束;明清两代的 24 位皇帝从封闭的世界中统治着中国，常常是不稳定和随意的，直到一个世纪前革命将他们全部扫地而出。尽管年代久远，但您看到的大多数建筑都是 18 世纪后清代的建筑和翻修——火灾是一种持续的危险，因此到处都是巨大的黄铜水缸。

Entering the Forbidden City
进入故宫

Through the Meridian Gate, you pass into a vast courtyard and cross the Golden Stream (金水, Jīn Shuǐ) – shaped to resemble a Tartar bow and spanned by five marble bridges – on your way to the magnificent Gate of Supreme Harmony (太和门, Tàihé Mén; map Google map; Forbidden City), beyond which the courtyard could hold an imperial audience of 100,000 people.
穿过子午门，你进入一个广阔的庭院，穿过金水（金水 ，Jīn Shuǐ）——形状像鞑靼弓，由五座大理石桥横跨——前往宏伟的太和门 （ 太和门 ，Tàihé Mén; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城）， 院子里可以容纳 10 万人的帝国觐见者。

Mounting the Wall
安装墙壁

Since 2018 visitors have been permitted to climb the Forbidden City’s Wall just inside and to the east of the Meridian Gate (午门, Wǔ Mén; map Google map; Forbidden City); follow it eastwards to the Corner Tower, and then north to the East Prosperity Gate. This route includes the Gallery of Historic Architecture, with exhibition spaces in the Corner Tower and the splendid East Prosperity Gate. In total, around three-quarters of the 3.4km wall wall can now be climbed: a fine way to leave the crowds behind and take awesome photographs.
自 2018 年以来，游客被允许攀登紫禁城墙，就在午门 （ 午门 ，Wǔ Mén; 地图谷歌地图 ;故宫）;沿着它向东走到角塔，然后向北到达东兴门。这条路线包括历史建筑画廊 ，角塔和壮丽的东繁华门设有展览空间。现在，总共可以攀登 3.4 公里的墙壁中的大约四分之三：这是远离人群并拍摄精彩照片的好方法。

First Side Galleries
第一侧画廊

Before you pass through the Gate of Supreme Harmony to reach the Forbidden City’s star attractions, veer off to the west of the huge courtyard to visit the Hall of Martial Valour (武英殿, Wǔyīng Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City), where emperors would receive ministers. It houses a changing line-up of exhibitions. Just to the south is the Furniture Gallery, occupying an area known as the Southern Storehouses, which opened for the first time in 2018.
在穿过太和门到达紫禁城的明星景点之前，请转向巨大的庭院以西参观武英殿 （ 武英殿 ，Wǔyīng Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城）， 皇帝会在那里接待大臣。它拥有不断变化的展览阵容。南边是家具画廊 ，占据了被称为南方仓库的区域，于 2018 年首次开放。

The Hall of Literary Brilliance (文化殿, Wénhuà Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City) complex to the east of the Meridian Gate was formerly used as a residence by the crown prince. It was rebuilt in 1683 after being destroyed by fire. It, too, hosts a changing line-up of exhibitions throughout the year, but is sometimes closed between November and March.
文辉殿堂（ 文化殿 ，Wénhuà Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城） 建筑群位于子午门以东，曾被用作皇太子的住所。1683 年被大火烧毁后重建。它全年也会举办不断变化的展览阵容，但有时会在 11 月至 3 月期间关闭。

Three Great Halls
三大礼堂

Raised on a three-tier marble terrace representing the Chinese character for king (王, wáng), are the Three Great Halls (三大殿, Sān Dàdiàn), the glorious heart of the Forbidden City. The Hall of Supreme Harmony (太和殿, Tàihé Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City) is the most important and largest structure in the Forbidden City, and was once the tallest building in the capital. It was used for state occasions, such as the emperor’s birthday, coronations and the nomination of military leaders. Inside the Hall of Supreme Harmony is a richly decorated Dragon Throne (龙椅, Lóngyǐ), from which the emperor would preside over trembling officials. The entire court had to touch the floor nine times with their foreheads (known as kowtowing) in the emperor’s presence. At the back of the throne is a carved Xumishan, the Buddhist paradise, signifying the throne’s supremacy. Today you can only view it from the outside, and it virtually requires a rugby scrum to do so.
三大殿 （ 三大殿 ，Sān Dàdiàn）矗立在代表汉字（ 王 ，wáng）的三层大理石露台上，是紫禁城的光荣中心。太和殿 （ 太和殿 ，Tàihé Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;故宫） 是故宫中最重要、规模最大的建筑，曾是首都最高的建筑。它被用于国家场合，例如皇帝的生日、加冕典礼和军事领导人的提名。太和殿内有一个装饰华丽的龙座 （ 龙椅 ，Lóngyǐ），皇帝会从上面主持颤抖的官员。整个朝廷在皇帝面前，额头要触地九次（称为磕头）。宝座的后面是雕刻的须弥山，佛教天堂，象征着宝座的至高无上。今天，你只能从外面观看它，而且它实际上需要橄榄球争球才能做到这一点。

Behind the Hall of Supreme Harmony is the Hall of Central Harmony (中和殿, Zhōnghé Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City), which was used as the emperor’s transit lounge. Here he would make last-minute preparations, rehearse speeches and receive ministers.
太和殿的后面是中和殿 （ 中和殿 ，Zhōnghé Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城）， 曾被用作皇帝的中转休息室。在这里，他会做最后一刻的准备，排练演讲并接待牧师。

The third of the Great Halls is the Hall of Preserving Harmony (保和殿, Bǎohé Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City), used for banquets and later for imperial examinations. The hall has no support pillars, and to its rear is a 250-tonne marble imperial carriageway carved with dragons and clouds, which was hauled into the city on an ingenious path of ice – they had to wait until winter to do so. The peripheral buildings surrounding the Three Great Halls were used for storing gold, silver, silks, carpets and other treasures, and now house museum exhibits.
第三个大殿是保和殿 （ 保和殿 ，Bǎohé Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城）， 用于宴请，后来用于科举考试。大厅没有支撑柱，后面是一条重达 250 吨的大理石御用车道雕刻着龙和云，这条车道是通过一条巧妙的冰路拖入城市的——他们必须等到冬天才能这样做。三大殿周围的外围建筑曾用于存放金、银、丝绸、地毯等珍宝，现在是博物馆展品的所在地。

Lesser Central Halls
小中央大厅

The basic configuration of the Three Great Halls is echoed by the next group of buildings, reached through the Gate of Heavenly Purity (乾清门, Qiánqīng Mén; map Google map; Forbidden City). Traditionally, this gate was the dividing line between the ceremonial outer court and the inner court to the north, where the emperors and their entourage actually lived and work. Smaller in scale, these buildings were more important in terms of real power, which in China traditionally lies at the back door.
三大殿的基本配置与下一组建筑相呼应，通过清天门 （ 乾清门 ，Qiánqīng Mén; 地图谷歌地图 ;故宫）。 传统上，这扇门是礼仪外庭和北面内庭的分界线，皇帝及其随从人员实际居住和工作的地方。这些建筑规模较小，但就实权而言更为重要，而在中国，实权传统上位于后门。

The first structure is the Palace of Heavenly Purity (乾清宫, Qiánqīng Gōng; map Google map; Forbidden City; c), a residence of Ming and early Qing emperors, and later an audience hall for receiving foreign envoys and high officials.
第一个结构是清天宫 （ 乾清宫 ，Qiánqīng Gōng; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城; c ），明朝和清初皇帝的住所，后来是接待外国使节和高官的觐见厅。

Immediately behind it is the Hall of Union (交泰殿, Jiāotài Diàn; map Google map; Forbidden City), which contains a clepsydra – a water clock made in 1745 with five bronze vessels and a calibrated scale. You’ll also find a mechanical clock built in 1797 and a collection of imperial jade seals on display. The Palace of Earthly Tranquillity (坤宁宫, Kūnníng Gōng; map Google map; Forbidden City) was the imperial couple’s bridal chamber and the centre of operations for the palace harem.
紧随其后的是协和堂 （ 交泰殿 ，Jiāotài Diàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城）， 其中包含一个 clepsydra——一个 1745 年制造的水钟，有五个青铜器皿和一个校准的刻度。您还会发现一个建于 1797 年的机械钟和一系列皇家玉玺。 人间宁静宫 （ 坤宁宫 ，Kūnníng Gōng; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城） 是皇室夫妇的洞房，也是宫廷后宫的运作中心。

Imperial Garden
御花园

map Google map
地图谷歌地图

At the northern end of the Forbidden City is the Imperial Garden (御花园, Yù Huāyuán; map; Forbidden City), a classical Chinese garden with 7000 sq metres of fine landscaping, including rockeries, walkways, pavilions and ancient, carbuncular cypresses. At its centre is the double-eaved Hall of Imperial Peace. Nearby, the Lodge of Spiritual Cultivation is where British tutor Sir Reginald Johnston gave English lessons to the abdicated ‘last emperor’ Puyi.
紫禁城的北端是御花园 （ 御花园 ，Yù Huāyuán; 地图 ;紫禁城） 是一座中国古典园林，拥有 7000 平方米的精美景观，包括假山、人行道、亭台楼阁和古老的柏树。其中心是双檐的帝国和平厅 。附近的修灵小屋是英国导师雷金纳德·约翰斯顿爵士为退位的“末代皇帝”溥仪上英语课的地方。

Treasure Gallery
宝藏馆

map Google map
地图谷歌地图

On the northeastern edge of the complex is what feels like a mini Forbidden City all of its own. This is the Palace of Tranquil Longevity (宁寿宫, Níng Shòu Gōng), built around 1771 for Qing Emperor Qianlong’s retirement, though he never moved in. Today it holds the Treasure Gallery (珍宝馆, Zhēn Bǎo Guǎn; map; Forbidden City; ¥10), one of the palace’s most important collections of ornamental objects, which are crafted from gold, silver, jade, emeralds, pearls, and other gems and semi-precious stones.
在建筑群的东北边缘，感觉就像一个独立的迷你紫禁城。这是宁寿宫（宁寿宫 ，Níng Shòu Gōng），建于 1771 年左右，为清朝乾隆皇帝退休而建，但他从未入住。 今天，它拥有珍宝馆 （ 珍宝馆 ，Zhēn Bǎo Guǎn; 地图 ;紫禁城;¥10） 是宫殿最重要的装饰品收藏之一，由金、银、玉、祖母绿、珍珠和其他宝石和半宝石制成。

The complex is entered from the south – not far from the unmissable Gallery of Clocks (钟表馆, Zhōngbiǎo Guǎn; map Google map; Forbidden City; ¥10; h8.30am-4pm). Just inside the entrance (map), you’ll find a beautiful glazed Nine Dragon Screen (九龙壁, Jiǔlóng Bì; map Google map; Forbidden City; incl in through ticket), modelled after the one in Beihai Park.
该建筑群从南边进入——距离不容错过的钟表馆（钟表馆 ，Zhōngbiǎo Guǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;紫禁城;¥10; h 上午 8 点 30 分至下午 4 点）。就在入口 （ 地图 ） 内，您会发现一个美丽的琉璃九龙屏风 （ 九龙壁 ，Jiǔlóng Bì; 地图谷歌地图 ; 紫禁城;包括直通票）， 仿照北海公园的那辆。

From there you work your way north, exploring various halls and courtyards before exiting at the northern end (map) of the Forbidden City. En route, seek out the Pavilion of Cheerful Melodies (畅音阁, Chàngyīn Gé; map; Forbidden City), a three-storey wooden opera house that was the palace’s largest theatre. Note the trapdoors that allowed actors to make dramatic stage entrances.
从那里你向北走，探索各种大厅和庭院，然后在紫禁城的北端 （ 地图 ） 离开。途中，寻找欢快旋律阁 （ 畅音阁 ，Chàngyīn Gé; 地图 ;紫禁城）， 一座三层楼的木制歌剧院，是宫殿最大的剧院。请注意允许演员戏剧性地进入舞台的活板门。

Western & Eastern Palaces
西宫和东宫

A dozen smaller palace courtyards lie to the west and east of the three lesser central halls. It was in these self-contained abodes, like far grander versions of Beijing’s sìhéyuàn mansions in the hutong, where most of the emperors and empresses actually lived. Many of the buildings, particularly those to the west, are decked out with imperial furniture.
十几个较小的宫殿庭院位于三个较小的中央大厅的西侧和东侧。正是在这些独立的住所中，就像北京胡同中思合元府邸的更宏伟版本一样，大多数皇帝和皇后实际上都住在那里。许多建筑，尤其是西边的建筑，都装饰着皇家家具。

Other Attractions
其他景点

Parts of the palace that were previously off limits are opening all the time. Due west of the Gate of Heavenly Purity is a collection of halls and gardens where the empresses and concubines of deceased emperors resided. Known as the Palace of Compassion and Tranquillity, it was used for storage for many decades after 1925 and today houses the Sculpture Gallery, which includes Buddhist statues, terracotta warriors, exquisite stone reliefs and more, from as far back as the Warring States period.
宫殿以前禁止进入的部分区域一直在开放。 天清门的正西边是已故皇帝的皇后和妃嫔居住的殿堂和花园的集合。它被称为慈悲与宁静宫 ，在 1925 年后被用于储存了几十年，如今是雕塑画廊的所在地，其中包括远至战国时期的佛像、兵马俑、精美的石浮雕等。

To the south is the Garden of Compassion and Tranquillity, where empress dowagers and imperial consorts worshipped the Buddha, entertained themselves and rested. To the west is the Palace of Longevity and Health, built for Emperor Qianlong’s mother.
南边是慈悲安宁园 ，皇太后和皇妃在这里拜佛、娱乐和休息。西边是长寿健康宫 ，是为乾隆皇帝的母亲建造的。

o

Gate of Heavenly PeaceHISTORIC SITE
天国和平之门历史遗迹

(天安门, Tiān’ānmén; map Google map; Xichang’an Jie, 西长安街; ¥15, bag storage ¥3-6; h8.30am-4.30pm, to 4pm Nov-Mar; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen West, exit B, or Line 1 to Tian’anmen East, exit A)
（ 天安门 ，Tiān'ānmén; 地图谷歌地图 ;西长安街西长安街 ;¥15，包寄¥3-6; h 11 月至 3 月上午 8：30 至下午 4：30，至下午 4：30; b 1 号线到天安门西 B 出口，或 1 号线到天安门东 A 出口）

Instantly recognisable by its giant framed portrait of Mao, and guarded by two pairs of Ming dynasty stone lions, the double-eaved Gate of Heavenly Peace (literally ‘Tian’anmen’) is a potent national symbol. Formerly the largest of the four gates of the Imperial City Wall, it was from here that Mao proclaimed the founding of the People’s Republic of China in 1949. Climb the gate for excellent views of Tian’anmen Sq. The ticket office (map) is on the northwest side of the gate.
双檐天安门（字面意思是“天安门”）以其巨大的毛画框肖像一眼就能认出，并由两对明代石狮守卫，是一个强大的国家象征。皇城城墙以前是皇城城墙四座城门中最大的一座，1949 年，毛从这里宣布了中华人民共和国的成立。爬上大门，欣赏天安门广场的美景。 售票处 （ 地图 ） 位于登机口的西北侧。

Mao’s portrait – a 6m x 4.6m oil painting repainted annually – is a relatively recent permanent addition. During the 1950s, it was only hung on the gate for the May and 1 October celebrations. In the early years of the PRC, the gate and its vicinity also occasionally sported portraits of Sun Yatsen, Karl Marx, Vladimir Lenin and Joseph Stalin. Mao has been a constant fixture since 1975. Either side of the portrait are placards reading: ‘Long Live the People’s Republic of China’ and ‘Long Live the Unity of the People of the World’.
毛的肖像——一幅 6 米 x 4.6 米的油画——每年都会重新绘制——是相对较新的永久添加。在 1950 年代，它只在 5 月和 10 月 1 日的庆祝活动中挂在大门上。在中国建国初期，大门及其附近偶尔也会挂着孙中山、卡尔·马克思、弗拉基米尔·列宁和约瑟夫·斯大林的肖像。自 1975 年以来，毛一直是固定人物。肖像的两侧都是标语牌，上面写着：“中华人民共和国万岁”和“世界人民团结万岁”。

oTian’anmen SquareSQUARE
o 天安门广场 SQUARE

(天安门广场, Tiān’ānmén Guǎngchǎng; map Google map; hopens before dawn, closes at night; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen West or Tian’anmen East, or Line 2 to Qianmen) F
（ 天安门广场 ，Tiān'ānmén Guǎngchǎng; 地图谷歌地图 ; h 黎明前开放，晚上关闭; b 1 号线至天安门西或天安门东，或 2 号线至前门） F

Flanked by triumphalist Sovietstyle buildings, Tian’anmen Sq is an immense void of paved stone (440,000 sq metres, to be precise) at the symbolic centre of the Chinese universe. Watched over by Mao’s portrait (and the eyes of hundreds of security personnel), it’s an iconic if disquieting place for a stroll. Highlights on the square itself include the daily flag-raising (and lowering) ceremony, Mao’s mausoleum and the Zhengyang Gate. Access is via the underpasses beside Tian’anmen East and Tian’anmen West subway stations (Line 1).
天安门广场两侧是凯旋式的苏联风格建筑，是中国宇宙的象征中心，是一块巨大的铺石空地（准确地说是 440,000 平方米）。在毛泽东的肖像（以及数百名安保人员的注视）的注视下，这是一个标志性的漫步场所，但却令人不安。广场本身的亮点包括每日升旗（和降旗）仪式、毛陵和正阳门。可通过天安门东站和天安门西地铁站（1号线）旁的地下通道进入。

The rectangular arrangement of the square, echoing the layout of the Forbidden City, to some extent pays obeisance to traditional Chinese culture, but most of its ornaments and buildings are Soviet-inspired. Mao conceived the square to project the power of the Communist Party, and during the Cultural Revolution he reviewed parades of up to a million people here. The ‘Tian’anmen Incident’, in 1976, is the term given to the near-riot in the square that accompanied the death of Premier Zhou Enlai. Another million people jammed the square to pay their last respects to Mao in the same year. Most infamously, in 1989 the army forced prodemocracy demonstrators out of the square. Hundreds – possibly thousands – lost their lives in the surrounding streets, an event the Chinese government has spent the intervening decades removing from the national consciousness. Contrary to widespread belief, it is thought that few if any were killed in the square itself. The famous ‘tank man’ photo was taken not on the square but from a balcony of the Beijing Hotel on Chang’an Jie; now Beijing Hotel NUO.
广场的长方形排列，与故宫的布局相呼应，在某种程度上向中国传统文化致敬，但其大部分装饰品和建筑都是苏联风格的。毛构思了广场来投射共产党的力量，在文化大革命期间，他在这里检阅了多达一百万人的游行。1976 年的“天安门事件”是对周恩来总理去世后广场上近乎骚乱的称呼。同年，又有一百万人挤在广场上，向毛致以最后的敬意。最臭名昭著的是，1989 年，军队将民主示威者赶出广场。数百人——可能是数千人——在周围的街道上丧生，中国政府在这几十年里一直将这一事件从国民意识中抹去。与普遍的看法相反，人们认为广场本身很少有人被杀。著名的“坦克人”照片不是在广场上拍摄的，而是在长安街北京饭店的阳台上拍摄的;现北京诺宾酒店 。

Early risers can watch the daily flagraising ceremony at sunrise, performed by a troop of People’s Liberation Army (PLA) soldiers marching at precisely 108 paces per minute, 75cm per pace. The soldiers emerge through the Gate of Heavenly Peace to goose-step impeccably across Dongchang’an Jie (the reverse ceremony is performed at sunset). In the centre of the square is the Monument to the People’s Heroes (人民英雄纪念碑, Rénmín Yīngxióng Jìniànbēi), a 40m-tall obelisk emblazoned with calligraphy from Mao and Zhou Enlai, while behind it sits the Chairman Mao Memorial Hall, where Mao’s body lies inside a glass coffin. At the foot of the square, the magnificent Zhengyang Gate can be climbed for superb views and an exhibition of historical photographs showing the area as it was at the beginning of the last century.
早起的人可以在日出时观看每天的升旗仪式 ，由一队中国人民解放军 （PLA） 士兵以每分钟 108 步、每步 75 厘米的速度行进。士兵们穿过天安门，鹅步无可挑剔地穿过东长安街（日落时分进行反向仪式）。广场中央是人民英雄纪念碑 ，这是一座 40 米高的方尖碑，上面刻有毛和周恩来的书法，后面是毛主席纪念馆，毛的遗体安葬在玻璃棺材内。在广场脚下，可以爬上宏伟的正阳门，欣赏壮丽的景色，并展出历史照片，展示该地区上世纪初的样子。

Gate of Heavenly Peace, Tian’anmen Square | MARIO GIL/SHUTTERSTOCK ©
天安门天安门门 |马里奥·吉尔/SHUTTERSTOCK ©

oChairman Mao Memorial HallMAUSOLEUM
o 毛主席纪念馆 MAUSOLEUM

(毛主席纪念堂, Máo Zhǔxí Jìniàntáng; map Google map; Tian’anmen Sq; bag storage ¥10, electronics storage per device ¥10; h8am-noon Tue-Sun; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen West or Tian’anmen East, or Line 2 to Qianmen) F
（ 毛主席纪念堂 ， Máo Zhǔxí Jìniàntáng; 地图谷歌地图 ;天安门广场;包存储 10 日元，每台设备电子产品存储 10 日元; h 周二至周日上午 8 点至中午; b 1 号线至天安门西或天安门东，或 2 号线至前门） F

One of Beijing’s more surreal spectacles is the sight of Mao Zedong’s embalmed corpse on public display within his mausoleum. The Soviet-inspired memorial hall was constructed just 10 months after Mao died in September 1976, and is a prominent landmark in the middle of Tian’anmen Sq. The Chairman is still revered across much of China, as evidenced by the snaking queues here; one or two are solemn-faced but many are in high spirits, treating it like any other stop on their Beijing tour.
北京更超现实的奇观之一是毛泽东经过防腐处理的尸体在他的陵墓内公开展示。这座苏联风格的纪念馆建于毛1976年9月去世仅10个月后，是天安门广场中央的著名地标。主席在中国大部分地区仍然受到尊敬，这里蜿蜒的队列就证明了这一点;有一两个人面色凝重，但许多人都精神抖擞，把它当作他们北京巡演的其他一站。

Before you join the queue, all bags and cameras need to be deposited at the signposted storage area beside the National Museum of China east of the square; collect them before 2pm. And don’t forget your passport – you won’t be let into the hall without it.
在加入队列之前，所有包包和相机都需要存放在广场东侧中国国家博物馆旁边的路标存放区;下午 2 点前领取。别忘了带上护照——没有护照，你就不会被允许进入大厅。

National Museum of ChinaMUSEUM
中国国家博物馆 MUSEUM

(中国国家博物馆, Zhōngguó Guójiā Bówùguǎn; map Google map; http://en.chnmuseum.cn; 东长安街16号, 16 Dongchang’an Jie; audio guide ¥30; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen East, exit D) F
（ 中国国家博物馆 ，Zhōngguó Guójiā Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;http://en.chnmuseum.cn; 东长安街 16 号 ，东长安街 16 号，16 号;语音导览 30 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间下午 4 点; b 1 号线至天安门东，D 出口） F

Vast and energy-sapping, China’s showpiece museum is housed in an immense 1950s Soviet-style building on the eastern side of Tian’anmen Sq, and claims to be the world’s largest by display space. Dozens of galleries present a party-line portrayal of Chinese civilisation – you could lose hours in the Ancient China exhibition alone, with its priceless ceramics, calligraphy, jade and bronze pieces from prehistoric China through to the late Qing dynasty. Passport required.
这座中国展品博物馆面积庞大，耗能，坐落在天安门广场东侧一栋巨大的 1950 年代苏联风格建筑内，号称是世界上最大的展示空间。数十家画廊展示了中国文明的党派风格写照——光是中国古代展览，您就可能会浪费几个小时，这里有从史前中国到清朝晚期的无价陶瓷、书法、玉器和青铜器。需要护照。

Great Hall of the PeopleNOTABLE BUILDING
人民大会堂著名建筑

(人民大会堂, Rénmín Dàhuìtáng; map Google map; Xichang’an Jie, 西长安街; adult ¥30, bag deposit ¥2-5; h8.15am-4pm, hours vary; bLine 1 to Qianmen, exit A, or Line 1 to Tian’anmen West, exit C)
（ 人民大会堂 ，Rénmín Dàhuìtáng; 地图谷歌地图 ;西长安街西长安街 ;成人¥30，行李押金¥2-5; h 上午 8.15 至下午 4 点，营业时间各不相同; b 1 号线到前门，A 出口，或 1 号线到天安门西，C 出口）

Monolithic and intimidating, the Stalinist Great Hall of the People (1959) houses the highest organ of state power, the National People’s Congress (NPC). While few travellers go inside, it’s worth the diversion to marvel at the 10,000-seat auditorium with a red star embedded in a galaxy of ceiling lights. The ticket office is on the south side of the building and bags must be checked.
斯大林主义人民大会堂（1959 年）铁板一块，令人生畏，是国家权力的最高机关——全国人民代表大会 （NPC） 的所在地。虽然很少有游客进入，但值得消遣一下，惊叹于拥有 10,000 个座位的礼堂，天花板灯星系中镶嵌着一颗红星。售票处位于大楼的南侧，必须托运行李。

oJingshan ParkPARK
o 景山公园 PARK

(景山公园, Jǐngshān Gōngyuán; map Google map; Jingshan Qianjie, 景山前街; ¥2; h6.30am-9pm, to 8pm Nov-Mar; bLines 6, 8 to Nanluoguxiang, exit A)
（ 景山公园 ， Jǐngshān Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ; 景山前街景山前街 ; ¥2; h 11 月至 3 月上午 6 时 30 分至晚上 9 时，至晚上 8 时; b 6、8 号线至南螺鼓巷 A 出口）

Beijing’s finest park is also one of the only hills in the inner city, a mound that was created from the loess (sediment) excavated to make the Forbidden City moat. Called Coal Hill by westerners during Legation days, Jingshan also serves as a feng shui shield, protecting the palace from evil spirits – or dust storms – from the north. Clamber to the top for a magnificent panorama of the capital and princely views over of the Forbidden City.
北京最好的公园也是内城仅有的山丘之一，这是一个由为制作紫禁城护城河而挖掘的黄土（沉积物）建造的土丘。在公使馆时代，景山被西方人称为煤山，它也起到了风水盾牌的作用，保护宫殿免受来自北方的邪灵或沙尘暴的侵害。爬到山顶，欣赏首都的壮丽全景和紫禁城的王子景观。

On the eastern side of the park, a locust tree stands in the place where the last of the Ming emperors, Chongzhen, hanged himself as rebels swarmed at the city walls. The original tree survived right up until the Cultural Revolution, some say, when it was uprooted. In the north of the park, the Shouhuang Temple (寿皇殿, Shòuhuáng Diàn; map; Jingshan Park, 景山公园; h9am-4pm; bLine 6 to Nanluoguxiang, exit A) F, built in 1749 under the reign of Emperor Qianlong to honour his royal ancestors, opened in 2018 after four years of restoration.
在公园的东侧，一棵槐树矗立在明朝末代皇帝崇祯上吊自杀的地方，当时叛军蜂拥而至城墙。有人说，原来的树一直存活到文化大革命期间，它被连根拔起。在公园的北面， 寿皇殿 （ 寿皇殿 ，Shòuhuáng Diàn; 地图 ; 景山公园 h 9am-4pm; b 6 号线至南螺姑巷 A） F 出口，建于 1749 年乾隆皇帝统治时期，为纪念皇室先祖而建，经过四年修复，于 2018 年开通。

Zhengyang GateHISTORIC SITE
正阳门历史遗迹

(正阳门城楼, Zhèngyáng Mén Chénglóu; map Google map; Tian’anmen Sq; ¥20, audio guide ¥20; h9am-4.30pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit A)
（ 正阳门城楼 ， Zhèngyáng Mén Chénglóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;天安门广场;20 日元，语音导览 20 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4.30，最后入场时间下午 4 点; b 2 号线到前门，A 出口）

Qianmen (前门), or the Front Gate, consists of a pair of gate-like towers; the northernmost being the 40m-high Zhengyang Gate, which was also the largest of the nine gates of the Inner City Wall and the only gate proper that still stands, and the Zhengyang Gate Arrow Tower, just south of here. The gate can be climbed for fine views of the square and houses a museum charting the history and demise of Beijing’s city fortifications.
前门，或称前门，由一对门状塔楼组成;最北端的是高 40 米的正阳门，也是内城墙九座城门中最大的一门，也是唯一一座现存的城门，正阳门箭塔就在这里以南。可以爬上大门欣赏广场的美景，并设有一座博物馆，记录了北京城市防御工事的历史和消亡。

oWorkers’ Cultural PalacePARK
o 工人文化宫公园

(劳动人民文化宫, Láodòng Rénmín Wénhuà Gōng, Imperial Ancestral Temple; map Google map; %010 6512 2856; Dongchang’an Jie, 东长安街; park/Sacrificial Hall ¥2/15; h6.30am-7.30pm; bLine 1 to Tian’anmen East, exit A)
（ 劳动人民文化宫 ，Láodòng Rénmín Wénhuà Gōng，皇家祖庙; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6512 2856;东长安街，东长安街 ;公园/祭祀堂 ¥2/15; h 早上 6.30 至晚上 7.30; b 1 号线至天安门东，A 出口）

One of Beijing’s best-kept secrets – despite being next to the Gate of Heavenly Peace – the Workers’ Cultural Palace was gifted to the masses by Mao in 1950 as a place of wholesome recreation. For several centuries prior, it was the most sacred temple in Beijing, where emperors would come to worship their ancestors. The cathedral-like Sacrificial Hall map Google map (太庙, Tài Miào; ¥15) is as magnificent as any imperial building in Beijing.
工人文化宫是北京最不为人知的秘密之一——尽管毗邻天安门 ——1950 年，毛将劳动文化宫作为有益健康的娱乐场所赠送给大众。在几个世纪之前，它是北京最神圣的寺庙，皇帝都会来这里祭拜他们的祖先。大教堂般的祭祀殿地图 （ 太庙 ，Tài Miào;15 日元） 与北京的任何皇家建筑一样宏伟。

Zhongshan ParkPARK
中山公园 PARK

(中山公园, Zhōngshān Gōngyuán; map Google map; 4 Zhonghua Lu, 中华路4号; adult ¥3, Spring Flower & Tulips Show ¥10; h6am-9pm; g5, bLine 1 to Tian’anmen West, exit B)
（ 中山公园 ， Zhōngshān Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ;4 中华路， 中华路 4 号 ;成人 ¥3，春花郁金香秀 ¥10; h 早上 6 点至晚上 9 点; g 5、 b 1 号线至天安门西 B 出口）

Named after China’s first president Sun Yatsen (alo called Sun Zhongshan), whose body was placed here briefly after his death, this lovely park, filled with flower displays and ancient cyprus trees, sits at the southwest corner of the Forbidden City facing the palace moat (you can rent pedal-boats here). The park used to be royal gardens containing the sacred Altar of Land and Grain map Google map (北京社稷坛, Shèjìtán), where the emperor offered sacrifices. The altar, a square open-air platform, is the centrepiece.
这个可爱的公园以中国第一任国家主席孙中山（孙中山）的名字命名，孙中山的遗体在他去世后曾短暂地安葬在这里，坐落在紫禁城的西南角，面对宫殿护城河（您可以在这里租用脚踏船）。该公园曾经是皇家花园，里面有神圣的土地和谷物祭坛地图谷歌地图 （ 北京社稷坛 ，Shèjìtán）， 皇帝在这里祭祀。祭坛是一个方形的露天平台，是中心装饰品。

National Art Museum of ChinaMUSEUM
中国美术馆 MUSEUM

(中国美术馆, Zhōngguó Měishùguǎn; map Google map; www.namoc.org; 1 Wusi Dajie, 五四大街1号; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLines 6, 8 to National Art Museum, exit A) F
（ 中国美术馆 ， Zhōngguó Měishùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.namoc.org;1 Wusi Dajie， 五四大街 1 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间为下午 4 点; b 6、8 号线至国立新美术馆 A 出口） F

Opened in 1963 with the personal endorsement of Mao Zedong, this gallery complex was conceived as the PRC’s national nerve centre for artistic expression. In recent years the museum has shaken off its reputation for stodgy, statesupervised exhibitions by inviting galleries from abroad to exhibit, while at the same time revamping its own output, often in collaboration with Beijing’s prestigious Central Academy of Fine Arts.
这座画廊综合体于 1963 年在毛泽东的亲自认可下开业，被设想为中国艺术表达的国家神经中枢。近年来，美术馆通过邀请国外画廊参展，摆脱了陈旧、国家监督展览的名声，同时经常与北京著名的中央美术学院合作，对自己的作品进行改造。

There are usually at least four exhibitions being staged at once. Check the website (in Chinese) to see what’s on. You’ll need your passport to enter.
通常同时至少举办四个展览。查看网站（中文）以了解正在进行的内容。您需要护照才能入境。

Wangfujing StreetSHOPPING STREET
王府井大街 SHOPPING STREET

(王府井大街, Wángfǔjǐng Dàjiē; map Google map; bLine 1 to Wangfujing, exit C2 or B)
（ 王府井大街 ，Wángfǔjǐng Dàjiē; 地图谷歌地图 ; b 1 号线往王府井，C2 或 B 出口）

Monolithic shopping malls face each other across this prestigious avenue thronged with mostly out-of-town tourists. The late-20th-century Chinese architecture is looking worn out these days (despite some local tour companies who rather hopefully dub Wangfujing Street ‘Beijing’s Champs-Elysées’), but developments like WF Central are adding a welcome touch of glamour.
单一的购物中心在这条享有盛誉的大道上面对面，挤满了大部分外地游客。如今，20 世纪末的中国建筑看起来已经破旧不堪（尽管一些当地旅游公司希望将王府井街称为“北京的香榭丽舍大街”），但像 WF Central 这样的开发项目正在增添一抹受欢迎的魅力。

Shijia Hutong MuseumMUSEUM
石家胡同博物馆 MUSEUM

(史家胡同博物馆, Shǐjiā Hútòng Bówùguǎn; map Google map; 24 Shijia Hutong, 史家胡同24号; h9.30am-4.30pm Tue-Sun; bLine 5 to Dengshikou) F
（ 史家胡同博物馆 ，Shǐjiā Hútòng Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ;24 Shijia Hutong， 史家胡同 24 号 h 9：30am-4：30pm 周二至周日; b 5 号线至灯市口） F

Shijia Hutong has seen plenty of action over the decades, as this spiffy museum in a rebuilt sìhéyuàn (courtyard residence) explains. English is ample throughout; you’ll learn a bit about the disputed etymology of the word ‘hutong’ (Mongolian or Han?), and be invited to admire scale models of Shijia Hutong, which, while visually impressive, don’t reveal much.
几十年来，石家胡同见证了许多活动，正如这座位于重建的 sìhéyuàn（四合院）中的漂亮博物馆所解释的那样。英语自始至终都很充足;您将了解一些关于 “胡同” 一词（蒙古语还是汉语）有争议的词源，并被邀请欣赏石家衚衚的比例模型，虽然视觉上令人印象深刻，但并没有透露太多信息。

Ancient ObservatoryOBSERVATORY
古天文台天文台

(古观象台, Gǔ Guānxiàngtái; map Google map; cnr Jianguomennei Dajie & East 2nd Ring Rd, 二环东路建国门桥; adult ¥20; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4.30pm; bLines 1, 2 to Jianguomen, exit A)
（ 古观象台 ，Gǔ Guānxiàngtái; 地图谷歌地图 ;建国门内大街东二环路交叉路口， 二环东路建国门桥 ;成人 20 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间下午 4：30; b 1、2 号线至建国门 A 出口）

Astronomers have been studying the mysteries of the cosmos here since 1442. Crowning the 18m-high brick tower – an earlier version of which would have been attached to Beijing’s city wall during the Ming dynasty – is a mind-boggling array of arcane astronomical instruments, made in brass, mounted on carved stone plinths and embellished with bronze dragons.
自 1442 年以来，天文学家一直在研究这里的宇宙奥秘。这座 18 米高的砖塔——明代的早期版本将附在北京的城墙上——顶部是一系列令人难以置信的神秘天文仪器，这些仪器由黄铜制成，安装在雕刻的石基座上，并装饰着青铜龙。

These include six grand contraptions designed by Ferdinand Verbiest, a 17th-century Jesuit missionary from Belgium. He was awarded the honour of managing the observatory by Emperor Kangxi after proving the greater accuracy of European astronomy, and correcting flaws in the Chinese calendar (which necessitated removing an entire month).
其中包括由来自比利时的 17 世纪耶稣会传教士费迪南德·韦尔比斯特 （Ferdinand Verbiest） 设计的六个宏伟装置。康熙皇帝在证明了欧洲天文学的更准确性并纠正了中国历法的缺陷（这需要删除整整一个月）后，被康熙皇帝授予管理天文台的荣誉。

The observatory actually dates back further to the Mongol-led Yuan dynasty, when it lay north of the present site. Kublai Khan, like subsequent Ming and Qing emperors, relied heavily on astronomers to plan military endeavours. This era also produced several celebrated Chinese astronomers, including Guo Shoujing, who developed the Chinese calendar and calculated a year precisely to 365.2425 days.
该天文台的历史实际上可以追溯到蒙古领导的元朝时期，当时它位于现址以北。忽必烈与后来的明清皇帝一样，严重依赖天文学家来规划军事行动。这个时代还产生了几位著名的中国天文学家，包括郭守敬，他发明了中国历法，将一年精确计算为365.2425天。

oZhihua TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 芝化寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(智化寺, Zhìhuà Sì; map Google map; 5 Lumicang Hutong, 禄米仓胡同5号; adult/audio guide ¥20/10; h8.30am-4.30pm, closed Mon; bLines 2, 6 to Chaoyangmen, exit G)
（ 智化寺 ，Zhìhuà Sì; 地图谷歌地图 ;5 禄米仓胡同 5 号 ;成人/语音导览 ¥20/10; h 上午 8：30 至下午 4：30，周一休息; b 2、6 号线至朝阳门，G 出口）

Lost in a tumbledown hutong neighbourhood, this Buddhist temple is one of Beijing’s best-preserved Ming dynasty structures. It was built in 1444 to honour a corrupt and powerful eunuch, Wang Zhen, who held tremendous sway over the guileless Emperor Zhengtong. Remarkable treasures within include the Ten Thousand Buddhas Hall with floor-to-ceiling wall niches filled with miniature Buddhist effigies.
这座佛教寺庙迷失在一个倒塌的小衚街区中，是北京保存最完好的明代建筑之一。它建于 1444 年，是为了纪念一位腐败而有权势的太监王振，他对狡猾的正统皇帝拥有巨大的影响力。里面的非凡宝藏包括万佛殿 ，落地壁龛里摆满了微型佛教雕像。

You won’t find the coffered vault ceiling of the Zhihua Hall (it’s in the USA), and the Four Heavenly Kings have vanished from Zhihua Gate, but the Scriptures Hall, to the west of the central courtyard, encases a spectacular, eight-sided zhuǎnlún zàng (转轮藏), a rotating scriptures cabinet mounted on a marble base, crowned with animal carvings and a seated Buddha beneath a mandala fresco.
你不会发现知化堂的格子拱顶（它在美国），四大天王已经从知化门消失了，但位于中央庭院西边的经文堂里有一个壮观的八面转轮藏 ，这是一个安装在大理石底座上的旋转经柜，顶部有动物雕刻和曼陀罗壁画下的坐佛。

The Ten Thousand Buddhas Hall is at the far rear of the complex, dominated by a trio of wood-carved deities (a 20ft-tall Tathagata Buddha, flanked by Brahma and Indra). Unfortunately, visitors are no longer allowed to climb to the 2nd floor, which houses a seated Buddha.
万佛殿位于建筑群的最后方，由三位木雕神灵（一尊 20 英尺高的如来佛，两侧是梵天和因陀罗）主导。不幸的是，游客不再被允许爬到二楼，那里有一尊坐佛。

Time your visit to coincide with a short musical performance, taking place in Zhihua Hall at 10am and 3pm daily. Performers use traditional Chinese instruments associated with Buddhist worship.
您的参观时间与每天上午 10 点和下午 3 点在芝化厅举行的简短音乐表演相吻合。表演者使用与佛教崇拜相关的中国传统乐器。

Following renovations in 2018, the temple has added several museum displays to its offerings, including notes on temple construction and restoration over the years, and an exhibit on ‘jing’ religious music.
经过 2018 年的翻修，寺庙在其产品中增加了几个博物馆展览，包括多年来寺庙建造和修复的笔记，以及关于“京”宗教音乐的展览。

Galaxy SohoARCHITECTURE
银河 Soho 建筑

(银河Soho, Yínhé Soho; map Google map; Chaoyangmennei Dajie, 朝阳门内大街; bLines 2, 6 to Chaoyangmen, exit G)
（ 银河 Soho， Yínhé Soho; 地图谷歌地图 ;朝阳门内大街， 朝阳门内大街 b 2、6 号线至朝阳门 G 出口）

After the CCTV Tower and the Bird’s Nest Stadium, Beijing’s Galaxy Soho trumpeted itself as the capital’s next modern architectural landmark when it opened in 2012. Zaha Hadid’s creation looks astonishing in photographs, the retail and office complex writhing futuristically like a Star Wars city (never mind that the adjoining hutong housing was bulldozed for its development). But up close you’ll see empty commercial units and poorly maintained public areas, and wonder where it all went wrong.
继中央电视塔和鸟巢体育馆之后，北京银河苏豪区于 2012 年开业，大肆宣称自己是首都的下一个现代建筑地标。扎哈·哈迪德 （Zaha Hadid） 的创作在照片中看起来令人惊叹，零售和办公综合体像星球大战城市一样未来主义地扭动着（别介意毗邻的胡同住宅被推平以开发）。但近距离观察，您会看到空荡荡的商业单位和维护不善的公共区域，并想知道哪里出了问题。

FORBIDDEN CITY TICKETS
故宫门票

Tickets for the Forbidden City now need to be booked and paid for online, but there’s a snag: at time of research the official ticketing website (https://gugong.ktmtech.cn) was in Chinese only. Although a single ticket booth remains open for foreign tourists, with daily visitor numbers capped at 80,000, you might be turned away if you arrive without a ticket. Many hotels and hostels can help you buy tickets in advance. You can also purchase tickets at Trip.com (www.trip.com), selecting either a morning or afternoon entry slot for the day of your choice. You will need your passport for entry.
紫禁城的门票现在需要在线预订和支付，但有一个障碍：在研究时，官方票务网站 （https://gugong.ktmtech.cn） 只有中文版本。虽然只有一个售票亭仍然对外国游客开放，每天的游客人数上限为 80,000 人，但如果您没有门票到达，您可能会被拒之门外。许多酒店和旅馆可以帮助您提前购票。您也可以在 Trip.com （www.trip.com） 购买门票，选择您选择的当天上午或下午入场时段。您需要护照才能入境。

1Drum Tower & Dongcheng North
1 鼓楼和东城北

oDrum TowerHISTORIC SITE
o 鼓楼历史遗址

(鼓楼, Gǔlóu; map Google map; Gulou Dongdajie, 鼓楼东大街; ¥20, Drum & Bell towers through ticket ¥30; h9am-5pm, last entry 4.40pm; bLine 8 to Shichahai, exit A2)
（ 鼓楼 ，Gǔlóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;鼓楼东大街， 鼓楼东大街 ;20 日元，鼓楼通票 30 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间下午 4 点 40 分; b 8 号线至什刹海，A2 出口）

Venerable bastions of timekeeping, the Drum Tower and its counterpart the Bell Tower were for centuries the tallest buildings in Beijing, lording it over the surrounding hutong. Up in the 46m-high tower, the great drums would beat to sound the curfew after nightfall in the Qing dynasty, and thereafter every two hours to coordinate the patrols of the city’s nightwatch.
鼓楼和钟楼是古老的计时堡垒，几个世纪以来一直是北京最高的建筑，凌驾于周围的胡同之上。在这座 46 米高的塔楼上，清朝夜幕降临后，大鼓会敲响宵禁，此后每两个小时就会敲响一次，以协调城市守夜人的巡逻。

Originally built in 1272, the Drum Tower (and the Bell Tower to the north) are aligned on Beijing’s central axis, at the heart of the former Mongol-led Yuan capital of Dàdū, as Beijing was then known. It was rebuilt by Emperor Yongle as part of his grand plan for Ming dynasty Beijing. Since then it has been destroyed and rebuilt several times (the current edition dates from around 1894).
鼓楼（和北边的钟楼）始建于 1272 年，位于北京的中轴线上，位于前蒙古领导的元首都大都（当时的北京）的中心。它是永乐皇帝重建的，作为他明朝北京宏伟计划的一部分。从那时起，它曾多次被毁坏和重建（当前版本的历史可以追溯到 1894 年左右）。

In 1924, after Puyi (the ‘Last Emperor’) had been evicted from the Forbidden City, the timekeeping functions of the towers ceased. The Drum Tower became a library for a time, and the Bell Tower a cinema.
1924年，溥仪（“末代皇帝”）被驱逐出紫禁城后，塔楼的计时功能停止了。鼓楼一度成为图书馆，钟楼一度成为电影院。

Accessed by a very steep stairway, the tower itself preserves the Night Watchman’s Drum (更鼓, Gēnggǔ), the sole survivor of the original watch drums. A drumming troupe bashes out rhythms on a set of replica drums every hour from 9.30am, with the last performance at 4.45pm (and no lunchtime performance at 12.30pm).
通过一条非常陡峭的楼梯进入，塔本身保留了守夜人鼓 （ 更鼓 ，Gēnggǔ），这是原始守夜鼓的唯一幸存者。从上午 9 点 30 分开始，一个鼓团每小时都会用一组复制鼓敲出节奏，最后一场演出是在下午 4 点 45 分（中午 12 点 30 分没有午餐时间表演）。

The original drummers would have known exactly when to bash their instruments thanks to a water clock (clepsydra), a copy of which is on display in the tower.
最初的鼓手会确切地知道何时敲击他们的乐器，这要归功于水钟（clepsydra），塔上陈列着它的副本。

Bell TowerHISTORIC SITE
钟楼历史遗址

(钟楼, Zhōnglóu; map Google map; Gulou Dongdajie, 鼓楼东大街; ¥20, Drum & Bell towers through ticket ¥30; h9am-5pm, last tickets 4.40pm; bLine 8 to Shichahai, exit A2)
（ 钟楼 ，Zhōnglóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;鼓楼东大街， 鼓楼东大街 ;20 日元，鼓楼通票 30 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后售票时间为下午 4.40; b 8 号线至什刹海，A2 出口）

The restrained, grey-stone edifice of the Bell Tower (Zhonglou) is arguably even more charming than its resplendent other half, the Drum Tower (Gulou), after which this area of Beijing is casually named. You can mount the steep steps to get a look at the giant copper bell, and peek out over the hutong from behind safety barriers.
钟楼（钟楼）内敛的灰色石头建筑可以说比它金碧辉煌的另一半鼓楼（鼓楼）更迷人，北京的这个地区随意地以鼓楼命名。您可以爬上陡峭的台阶，欣赏巨大的铜钟，并从安全屏障后面窥视衚衕 。

Along with the Drum Tower, the Bell Tower was Beijing’s official timekeeper throughout the Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasties, until 1924. The bell, claimed to weigh over 54 tonnes, was sounded in sequence together with the drums to mark the changes of the morning and night watches. Since 1990, the bell has been rung once a year on 31 December.
钟楼与鼓楼一起，在元、明、清三代一直担任北京的官方计时，直到 1924 年。据称重达 54 吨的钟与鼓声一起依次响起，以标记早更和夜更的变化。自 1990 年以来，钟声每年在 12 月 31 日敲响一次。

Buy your ticket for the Bell Tower at the Drum Tower.
在鼓楼购买钟楼门票。

oLama TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 喇嘛寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(雍和宫, Yōnghé Gōng; map Google map; www.yonghegong.cn; 12 Yonghegong Dajie, 北新桥雍和宫大街12号; ¥25, audio guide ¥50; h9am-4.30pm; bLines 2, 5 to Yonghegong-Lama Temple, exit C)
（ 雍和宫 ，Yōnghé Gōng; 地图谷歌地图 ;www.yonghegong.cn;12 Yonghegong Dajie， 北新桥雍和宫大街 12 号 ;25 日元，语音导览 50 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 4.30; b 2、5 号线至雍和宫-雍和宫，C 出口）

Converted from a princely residence to a lamasery in the 18th century, the Lama Temple extends through a crescendo of ever more divine halls in a whirl of incense and prayer wheels to its astonishing finale, an 18m-high statue of Buddha carved from a single trunk of Tibetan sandalwood. Expect to spend at least an hour wandering the halls and courtyards, admiring the architecture, statues, wall-mounted mandalas and temple relics on show throughout.
喇嘛寺于 18 世纪从王室改建为喇嘛寺，在香和转经轮的旋转中穿过越来越神圣的大厅，直至其令人惊叹的压轴，一尊 18 米高的佛像，由一根藏檀树干雕刻而成。预计至少要花一个小时在大厅和庭院中漫步，欣赏到处展示的建筑、雕像、壁挂式曼荼罗和寺庙遗迹。

The most revered Tibetan Buddhist temple outside Tibet, the Lama Temple was originally the royal residence of the prince who would become the Yongzheng emperor, hence the yellow roof tiles on its central halls. While it remains an active place of worship staffed by monks, the temple is today visited mostly by tourists.
雍和宫是西藏以外最受尊敬的藏传佛教寺庙，最初是后来成为雍正皇帝的王子的皇家住所，因此其中央大厅的屋顶瓦片是黄色的。虽然它仍然是一个活跃的礼拜场所，由僧侣组成，但如今这座寺庙主要由游客参观。

Arranged on a north–south axis, the temple halls ascend in height and importance as you move through the complex. The Hall of the Wheel of the Law (Fǎlún Diàn), the fourth hall, contains a substantial bronze statue of a benign and smiling Tsongkhapa (1357–1419), founder of the Gelug school or Yellow Hat sect.
寺庙大厅沿南北轴线排列，当您穿过建筑群时，寺庙大厅的高度和重要性都会上升。第四个法轮殿 （Fǎlún Diàn）有一尊巨大的青铜雕像，是一位温和而微笑的宗喀巴大师（1357-1419 年），他是格鲁派或黄帽教派的创始人。

The fifth hall, the Wanfu Pavilion (Wànfú Gé), reveals an awe-inspiring, 18m-tall statue of the Maitreya Buddha in its Tibetan form, clothed in yellow satin and reputedly carved from a single trunk of Tibetan sandalwood. The statue was a gift from the seventh Dalai Lama to the Emperor Qianlong, and took three years to be transported from Lhasa to the capital. A further 8m of the statue is concealed below ground.
第五个大殿， 万福阁 （Wànfú Gé），展示了一尊令人敬畏的 18 米高的藏式弥勒佛像，身着黄色绸缎，据说是用一根藏檀树干雕刻而成的。这尊雕像是七世达赖喇嘛送给乾隆皇帝的礼物，历时三年才从拉萨运到京城。雕像的另外 8m 隐藏在地下。

The two rearmost side halls, Jietai Lou and Banchan Lou, are given over to changing displays of religious relics and treasures from the temple, served up with a tendentious account of China’s relationship with Tibet and Tibetan Buddhism.
最后面的两座偏殿， 介台楼和班禅楼 ，被交给寺庙的宗教文物和珍宝的不断展示，并倾向于描述中国与西藏和藏传佛教的关系。

Confucius Temple & Imperial CollegeCONFUCIAN TEMPLE
孔庙和帝国学院孔庙

(孔庙、国子监, Kǒng Miào & Guózǐjiàn; map Google map; 13 Guozijian Jie, 国子监街13号; ¥30, audio guide ¥30; h8.30am-6pm Tue-Sun, to 5pm Nov-Apr, last entry 1hr before closing; bLines 2, 5 to Yonghegong-Lama Temple, exit C)
（ 孔庙、国子监 、Kǒng Miào 和 Guózǐjiàn; 地图谷歌地图 ;13 国子监街 13 号 ;30 日元，语音导览 30 日元; h 周二至周日上午 8 点 30 分至下午 6 点，11 月至 4 月下午 5 点，最后入场时间为闭馆前 1 小时; b 2、5 号线至雍和宫-雍和宫，C 出口）

An incense stick’s toss away from the Lama Temple, China’s second-largest Confucian temple is a haven of scholarly calm and contemplation. Come to wander between the towering stone stelae mounted on the backs of mythical bìxì (mythical, tortoise-like dragons) and inscribed with the achievements of scholars past. For centuries, China’s sharpest minds would sit for imperial examinations on the Confucian classics at the connecting Guózǐjiàn, which was replaced by the Imperial University of Peking (what would become Peking University) in 1898.
从中国第二大孔庙雍和宫抛出一炷香，是学术平静和沉思的天堂。来到高耸的石碑之间漫步，这些石碑安装在神话中的 bìxì（神话中的状龙）的背面，上面刻有过去学者的成就。几个世纪以来，中国最敏锐的头脑都会在相连的国子监参加儒家经典科举考试，该校于 1898 年被北京帝国大学（后来的北京大学）取代。

At the rear of the Confucius Temple are the Qianlong Stone Scriptures, a stone ‘forest’ of 190 stelae recording the 13 Confucian classics in 630,000 Chinese characters. Next to the Confucius Temple, but within the same grounds, stands the Imperial College, where the emperor expounded the Confucian classics to an audience of thousands of kneeling students, professors and court officials – an annual rite. Built by the grandson of Kublai Khan in 1306, the former college was the supreme academy during the Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasties. The Biyong Hall (辟雍大殿, Pìyōng Dàdiàn) is a twin-roofed structure with yellow (royal) tiles surrounded by a moat and topped with a splendid gold knob. Inside the stupendous interior is housed a vermilion-and-gold lectern. The side pavilions feature several interesting museums on Confucianism, detailing the life of the Great Sage (551–479 BC) and the academy itself.
孔庙后方是《 乾隆石经 》，这是一片由 190 块石碑组成的石“林”，用 63 万字记录了 13 部儒家经典。在孔子庙旁边，但在同一场地内，矗立着帝国学院 ，皇帝在那里向成千上万跪着的学生、教授和宫廷官员讲述儒家经典——这是一年一度的仪式。前书院由忽必烈的孙子于 1306 年建造，是元、明、清时期的最高学堂。 辟雍大殿（辟雍大殿 ，Pìyōng Dàdiàn）是一座双屋顶结构，采用黄色（皇家）瓦片，周围环绕着护城河，顶部有一个华丽的金色旋钮。在宏伟的内部，有一个朱红色和金色的讲台。侧亭设有几个有趣的儒家博物馆，详细介绍了大圣（公元前 551-479 年）的生平和学院本身。

Some of Beijing’s last remaining páilóu (decorative archways) survive on the street outside (Guozijian Jie).
北京仅存的一些装饰牌坊（装饰牌坊）幸存下来在外面的街道上（国子监街）。

Nánluógǔ XiàngSTREET
南罗古香街

(南锣鼓巷, South Gong & Drum Lane; map; Nanluogu Xiang; bLines 6, 8 to Nanluoguxiang, exit E)
（ 南锣鼓巷 ，南锣鼓巷; 地图 ;南罗古香; b 6、8 号线至南螺鼓巷 E 出口）

Beijing’s most touristy hutong, Nanluogu Xiang is a north–south strip of snack stalls, small food courts, souvenir shops and more people than you can possibly imagine crowding onto a single street. The main reason to visit is to delve into the quieter alleys that cross the main lane, fishbone-style, where you’ll turn up a more compelling array of cafes, bars and restaurants between historic residences.
南螺崮巷是北京旅游最多的胡同， 是一条南北走向的小吃摊、小美食广场、纪念品商店，人多得比你想象的挤在一条街上还要多。参观的主要原因是深入穿过主巷的安静小巷，鱼骨风格，在那里您会发现历史悠久的住宅之间有一系列更引人注目的咖啡馆、酒吧和餐馆。

It wasn’t too long ago that Nanluogu Xiang was a sleepy residential hutong. Even after bars started to open up in the early noughties, it remained a hip destination for those in the know. The alley was given a makeover in 2006, and another in 2016, and today is mostly snack vendors sating the daily hordes with everything from churros to bubble tea. Authentic it ain’t, but a few creative businesses have endured, like iconic T-shirt brand Plastered 8, here since 2006.
不久前，南螺谷香还是一个昏昏欲睡的住宅胡同 。即使在上世纪九十年代初酒吧开始开业后，它仍然是知情人士的时尚目的地。这条小巷于 2006 年进行了改造，并于 2016 年进行了另一次改造，如今主要是小吃摊贩，每天用从油条到珍珠奶茶等各种食物来满足成群结队的人。它不是正宗的，但一些创意企业已经经久不衰，例如标志性 T 恤品牌 Plastered 8，自 2006 年以来一直在这里。

Overseas Chinese History MuseumMUSEUM
华侨历史博物馆 MUSEUM

(中国华侨历史博物馆, Zhōngguó Huáqiáo Lìshǐ Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %010 6409 3039; www.ocmuseum.cn; Beixinqiao Santiao Dong Kou, 北新桥三条东口; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLine 5 to Beixinqiao, exit B) F
（ 中国华侨历史博物馆 ， Zhōngguó Huáqiáo Lìshǐ Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6409 3039;www.ocmuseum.cn;北新桥三条东口 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点，最后入场时间为下午 4 点; b 5 号线至北新桥，B 出口） F

Charting the history of Chinese emigration from the era of the Silk Road to the present day, this is a terrific museum with full English captions throughout. Diorama-rich exhibits celebrate the plucky Chinese diaspora, from American gold-rush adventurers to the hugely influential Chinese communities in Southeast Asia. If you even have a passing interest in the subject, it’s a must visit.
这幅博物馆描绘了从丝绸之路时代到现在的中国移民历史，是一座很棒的博物馆，全程都有完整的英文字幕。立体模型丰富的展品颂扬了勇敢的华侨，从美国淘金热冒险家到东南亚极具影响力的华人社区。如果您对这个主题有短暂的兴趣，那么这是必去之地。

DON’T MISS
不要错过

A thrilling discovery, the exquisite collection of treasures at the Poly Art Museum (保利艺术博物馆, Bǎolì Yìshù Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %010 6500 8117; 9th fl, Poly Plaza, 14 Dongzhimen Nandajie, 东直门南大街14号保利大厦9层; ¥20; h9.30am-4.30pm, closed Sun; bLine 2 to Dongsi Shitiao, exit D) is hidden halfway up an office building! China’s state-owned Poly Group has funnelled a fraction of its mega-wealth into buying up Chinese antiquities from auctions overseas, displayed here on artfully lit plinths. There are ancient bronzes from the Shang and Zhou dynasties, vividly detailed Buddha statuary, and several of the 12 bronze zodiac animals plundered at the sacking of the Old Summer Palace in 1860 – Poly Group is still rounding up the rest.
保利艺术博物馆 （Bǎolì Yìshù Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6500 8117;东直门南大街东直门南大街 14 号保利大厦 9 层，保利大厦 9 层 ; h 上午 9：30 至下午 4：30，周日休息; b 2 号线到东四石条，D）出口就藏在一栋写字楼的半路上！中国国有企业保利集团（Poly Group）将其巨额财富的一小部分用于从海外拍卖会上购买中国文物，这些古物陈列在艺术照明的基座上。这里有商周时期的古代青铜器，细节生动的佛像，还有 1860 年圆明园洗劫时被掠夺的 12 种青铜生肖中的几件——保利集团仍在围捕其余的。

Buy your tickets from the information counter in the lobby of the Poly Plaza building, then ride the lift to the 9th floor.
在保利广场大楼大堂的问讯处购买门票，然后乘坐电梯到9楼。

LOCAL KNOWLEDGE
当地知识

EXPLORING THE HUTONG
探索胡同

One of the pleasures of Beijing is picking your way through the hutong, a dense matrix of grey-brick alleyways surviving in pockets within Beijing’s old centre, and brimming with local life. A unique form of residential architecture, the hutong are Beijing’s everdiminishing heart and soul – visit before they’re gone.
北京的乐趣之一就是在胡同中挑选出路，胡同是一条密密麻麻的灰砖小巷，在北京老城区的小口袋里幸存下来，充满了当地生活。 衚衕是一种独特的住宅建筑形式，是北京不断衰落的心脏和灵魂——在它们消失之前参观一下。

Around the Drum Tower
鼓楼周围

Bookended by the Drum Tower and the Lama Temple is Beijing’s buzziest district of historic hutong alleyways, and the best area of the city for strolling. Gulou Dongdajie, the main east–west drag, divides an enticing grid of hutong to the north and south, including Nanluogu Xiang, Beijing’s most overhyped alley, which is easily avoided in favour of quieter, more authentic lanes.
鼓楼和雍和宫是北京最繁华的历史胡同小巷区，也是城市最佳漫步区。鼓楼东大街是东西向的主要街道，将一道诱人的胡同分为南北，包括南螺姑巷 ，这是北京最被夸大的胡同，很容易避开，取而代之的是更安静、更真实的小巷。

Subway Take Line 8 to Shichahai.
地铁乘坐 8 号线到什刹海。

Hutongs of Xisi
西西胡同

The Xisi area is one of Beijing’s most authentic and least touristed hutong neighbourhoods, where views of the ancient White Dagoba Temple loom over tiled rooftops. Venture into the hutong north of Fuchengmen Inner St and around Xisi subway station and you’ll discover a Beijing that time forgot. Men stroll about in Mao suits, holes-in-the-wall bake sesame shaobing bread, and the soundtrack is authentically gruff Běijīnghua, the local dialect.
西西地区是北京最真实、游客最少的胡同街区之一，古老的白达戈巴寺的景色在瓦片屋顶上若隐若现。冒险进入阜城门内街以北和西四地铁站周围的胡同 ，您会发现一个被时间遗忘的北京。男人们穿着毛西装漫步，在墙上烤着芝麻烧饼，配乐是地道粗犷的白井花，一种当地方言。

Subway Take Line 4 to Xisi or Line 2 to Fuchengmen.
地铁乘坐 4 号线到西寺或 2 号线到阜城门。

Down in Dashilar
在达希拉尔

The gentrifying hutong district of Dashilar, southwest of Tian’anmen Sq, rewards the explorer with hip cafes, Republic-era architecture and mahjong dens. Delve into the alleys flowing west from Meishi Jie – like Yangmeizhu Xiejie, a former printing street once home to author Lu Xun. The history buffs at Beijing Postcards run local walking tours through what was Beijing’s red-light district before 1949.
天安门广场西南部的大石剌高档胡同区为探险家提供时尚的咖啡馆、民国时代的建筑和麻将馆。深入从眉石街向西流淌的小巷——就像杨美竹谢街一样，这里曾经是作家鲁迅的故乡，曾经是一条印刷街。 北京明信片的历史爱好者在 1949 年之前的北京红灯区进行当地徒步旅行。

Subway Take Line 2 to Qianmen.
地铁乘坐 2 号线到前门。

1Beihai Park & Xicheng North
1 北海公园和西城北

oBeihai ParkPARK
o 北海公园 PARK

(北海公园, Běihǎi Gōngyuán; map Google map; %010 6403 1102; 1 Wenjin Jie, 文津街1号; high/low season ¥10/5, through ticket ¥20/15; h6.30am-8.30pm, sights to 5pm; bLine 6 to Beihai North)
（ 北海公园 ， Běihǎi Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6403 1102; 文津街 1 号， 文津街 1 号 ;旺/淡季 ¥10/5，直通票 ¥20/15; h 早上 6.30 至晚上 8.30，景点至下午 5 点; b 6 号线至北海北）

Beihai Park, inside the old Imperial City, looks much as it would have done in the 18th century when it served as Emperor Qianlong’s private gardens. The Tibetanstyle White Dagoba soars majestically over the lake (Beihai means ‘northern sea’), around which are found temples, pavilions, imperial stelae and other grand designs. A public park since 1925, Beihai now offers a window onto pastimes like dìshū (地书), where locals demonstrate their calligraphy skills using giant brushes and water.
北海公园位于旧皇城内，看起来与 18 世纪作为乾隆皇帝私人花园时的样子非常相似。藏式白大哥坝巍然耸立在湖面上空（北海意为“北海”），湖面周围有寺庙、亭台楼阁、御碑等宏伟设计。北海自 1925 年以来一直是公园，现在为人们提供了一个了解地书等消遣活动的窗口，当地人在这里用巨大的毛笔和水展示他们的书法技巧。

Beihai has been a royal playground since the Jin dynasty (1115–1234), when Jade Islet was shaped from the earth scooped out to create the lake. Crowning the islet is the 36m-high Tibetan-style White Dagoba map Google map (白塔, Báitǎ; ¥30, not incl in through ticket for Beihai Park; h9am-5pm), built in 1651 by the first Qing emperor to honour a visit by the Dalai Lama. You can reach the islet by boat (¥5 to ¥15) or via bridges at the south and east gates. Entering via the south gate is the grand approach because you can climb up the steep southern approach through Yong’an Temple map Google map (永安寺, Yǒngān Sì; incl in through ticket for Beihai Park) to the top.
自晋朝（1115-1234 年）以来，北海一直是皇家游乐场，当时玉岛是用挖出的泥土形成的，形成了湖泊。小岛的顶部是 36 米高的藏式白大哥坝地图谷歌地图 （ 白塔 ，Báitǎ;30 日元，不含北海公园直通票; h 上午 9 点至下午 5 点）， 由清朝第一位皇帝于 1651 年建造，以纪念达赖喇嘛的到访。您可以乘船（5 至 15 日元）或通过南门和东门的桥梁到达该岛。从南门进入是宏伟的参道，因为您可以通过永安寺地图谷歌地图 （ 永安寺 ，Yǒngān Sì;包括北海公园的直通票） 爬上陡峭的南参道到达山顶。

The north shore of Beihai has the most interesting buildings. Jingxin Studio map Google map (静心斋, Jìngxīn Zhāi) F, a ‘garden within a garden’, was a favourite retreat of Emperor Qianlong, who would sip tea, listen to the plucking of the guqin (Chinese zither) and enjoy the carp-filled pools and scenic views. Western Elysium map Google map (西天梵境, Xītiān Fánjìng; incl in through ticket for Beihai Park), with its centrepiece Míng-era hall (recently restored) made of unpainted cedar, was a lamasery during the Ming dynasty, and was later rebuilt by Emperor Qianlong. Nearby is the Nine Dragon Screen map Google map (九龙壁, Jiǔlóng Bì; incl in through ticket for Beihai Park), a 5m-high, 27m-long ‘spirit wall’ emblazoned with writhing dragons picked out in coloured glazed tiles. At the northeast corner of the lake, Little Western Heaven map Google map (小西天, Xiǎoxītiān; incl in through ticket for Beihai Park) is the largest square pavilion-style palace in China, built in secret as a gift for Emperor Qianlong’s mother on her 80th birthday. Inside the cavernous hall is an enormous and rather garish diorama of Mt Sumeru.
北海北岸有最有趣的建筑。静心斋 Google map（ 静心斋 ，Jìngxīn Zhāi） F 是“园中之圃”，是乾隆皇帝最喜欢的度假胜地，他会喝茶，听古琴的弹奏，欣赏鲤鱼池和美景。西天梵境（西天梵境 ，Xītiān Fánjìng;包括北海公园的直通票）， 其中心是明朝的明代大厅（最近修复），由未上漆的雪松制成，是明朝时期的喇嘛寺，后来由乾隆皇帝重建。附近有九龙屏地图谷歌地图 （ 九龙壁 ，Jiǔlóng Bì;包括北海公园的直通票）， 这是一堵高 5 米、长 27 米的“灵墙”，上面刻着用彩色琉璃瓦挑选的扭动的龙。小西天地图（小西天 ，Xiǎoxītiān，包括北海公园的直通票） 位于湖的东北角，是中国最大的方形亭子式宫殿，是秘密建造的，是乾隆皇帝母亲 80 岁生日时的礼物。在洞穴般的大厅内，有一个巨大而相当花哨的须弥山立体模型。

This circular fortress known as Round City map Google map (团城, Tuán Chéng; ¥1; bLine 4 to Xisi, exit C), just outside the south gate of Beihai, was the site of Kublai Khan’s palace in the Yuan dynasty. All that survives are a few ancient cypress trees and a vast, ceremonial wine vessel made of green jade dating from 1265. It’s on display in front of the Hall of Divine Light (Chéngguāng Diàn), where a 1.5m-tall statue of Sakyamuni, made from Burmese ‘white jade’, can be admired from afar.
这座被称为圆城地图的圆形堡垒 Google map（ 团城 ，Tuán Chéng;¥1; b 4 号线到西四，C）出口 ，就在北海南门外，是元代忽必烈宫殿的遗址。幸存下来的只有几棵古老的柏树和一个巨大的、由绿玉制成的仪式酒器，其历史可追溯至 1265 年。它陈列在圣光殿 （Chéngguāng Diàn）前，远处可以欣赏到一尊 1.5 米高的释迦牟尼雕像，由缅甸的“白玉”制成。

oHouhai Lake Scenic AreaLAKE
o 后海湖风景区 LAKE

(什刹海, Shíchàhǎi; map Google map; c; bLine 8 to Shichahai, exit A1, or Line 6 to Beihai North, exit B) F
（ 什刹海 ，Shíchàhǎi; 地图谷歌地图 ; c b 8 号线到什刹海，A1 出口，或 6 号线到北海北，B 出口） F

A grand sweep of willow-lined waterways enclosed by invitingly maze-like hutongs, this trio of lakes is one of Beijing’s best-loved outdoor spots, whether for strolling, fishing, pedal-boating, or ice-skating in winter. After dark, live-music bars skirting the shores of Qianhai (Front Lake) and Houhai (Back Lake) blare into life. Xihai (West Lake) is more idyllic. Several worthwhile sights can be found here, notably Prince Gong’s Mansion and Song Qingling’s Former Residence.
这三个湖泊是一望无际的柳树成荫的水道，周围环绕着迷人的迷宫般的胡同 ，是北京最受欢迎的户外景点之一，无论是散步、钓鱼、脚踏船还是冬季滑冰。天黑后，前海（前湖）和后海（后湖）沿岸的现场音乐酒吧开始活跃起来。西海（西湖）更田园诗般的。这里有几个值得参观的景点，特别是恭王府和宋庆龄故居 。

The lakes date back to the Yuan dynasty and the canal system built by engineers to transport drinking water into the capital. Houhai once marked the northern terminus of the Grand Canal, and became a royal retreat during the Qing dynasty as Manchu nobles built their mansions around it, the most famous of which is Prince Gong’s Mansion.
这些湖泊的历史可以追溯到元代，以及工程师修建的运河系统，将饮用水输送到首都。后海曾经是大运河的北端终点站，清朝时期满清贵族围绕它建造了自己的豪宅，成为皇家的隐居地，其中最著名的是恭王府。

There are pedal-boat hire stations around the shoreline of Houhai and Qianhai; snacks and cold beers can be picked up at lakeside shops for an impromptu picnic afloat. Some of the best people-watching can be had at the public exercise area (新街口社区健身乐园, Xīnjiēkǒu Shèqū Jiànshēn Lèyuán; map; Houhai Lake North Shore, 后海北沿; h24h; bLine 8 to Shichaihai, exit A2) F on the north shore of Houhai, especially in winter when hardy locals take an ice-dip in the water. Rickshaw drivers ply the shoreline hawking ‘hutong tours’, though few speak English.
后海和前海海岸线周围设有脚踏船租赁站;您可以在湖畔商店购买小吃和冰镇啤酒，在海上即兴野餐。在公共运动区 （ 新街口社区健身乐园 ，Xīnjiēkǒu Shèqū Jiànshēn Lèyuán; 地图 ;后海北 h 沿 24h; b 8 号线到后海北岸的什柴海，A2 出口）， F 尤其是在冬天，耐寒的当地人会在水中冰上畅游。人力车司机在海岸线上兜售“胡同之旅”，但很少有人会说英语。

When the lakes freeze over (usually from mid-December to early March), Qianhai becomes an enormous ice-skating rink, separated into two zones. The larger one is given over to ice-trikes and chair sleds (great fun for kids), while the smaller section is for skaters. Expect to pay ¥80 to get on to the ice.
当湖泊结冰时（通常从12月中旬到3月初），前海就变成了一个巨大的溜冰场，分为两个区域。较大的部分用于冰上三轮车和椅子雪橇（对孩子们来说非常有趣），而较小的部分则供滑冰者使用。预计需要支付 80 日元才能上冰。

Prince Gong’s MansionGARDENS
恭王府花园

(恭王府, Gōng Wángfǔ; map Google map; %010 8328 8149; 17 Qianhai Xijie, 前海西街17号; ¥40, tours incl opera show & tea ceremony ¥70; h8am-5pm Apr-Oct, 9am-4pm Nov-Mar; bLine 6 to Beihai North, exit B)
（ 恭王府 ，Gōng Wángfǔ; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 8328 8149; 前海西街前海西街前街 17 号 ，40 日元，含戏曲表演、茶道 70 日元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 8 点至下午 5 点，11 月至 3 月上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 6 号线至北海北，B 出口）

The sprawling residence of Prince Gong (1833–1898), half-brother of the Xianfeng emperor, is most notable for its marvellous gardens, which feature artificial hills, ponds, rocks that mimic mountain ranges, whimsical pavilions and even a Great Wall folly. The architectural highlights of this fantastical royal playground are the Western-style Gate (西洋门; Xīyáng mén), a marble portal built in the Jesuit style, and the wisteria-adorned Grand Theatre House (大戏楼; Dàxì Lóu), where tour groups (lots of them) are treated to short Peking opera performances.
咸丰皇帝同父异母的兄弟恭亲王（1833-1898 年）的庞大住所以其奇妙的花园而闻名，其中包括人造山丘、池塘、模仿山脉的岩石、异想天开的亭台楼阁，甚至还有长城的愚蠢行为。这个奇幻的皇家游乐场的建筑亮点是西洋门（西洋门 ;Xīyáng mén）、耶稣会风格的大理石门户，以及紫藤装饰的大戏楼（大戏楼 ;Dàxì Lóu），旅行团（其中很多）可以在这里观看简短的京剧表演。

Built in 1777 for Heshen, a corrupt Qing dynasty official doted on by Emperor Qianlong, the mansion didn’t pass to Prince Gong until 1851. During the Second Opium War in 1860, successive Anglo-French victories sent the emperor and his inner court fleeing Beijing, leaving Prince Gong to sign the Treaty of Peking on his emperor’s behalf, which ceded Kowloon to the British and allowed foreign ambassadors to install themselves permanently in Beijing. Prince Gong would later become the Prince Regent under Empress Cixi, and run the Qing dynasty’s foreign ministry.
这座宅邸建于 1777 年，是乾隆皇帝宠爱的清朝腐败官员和珅，直到 1851 年才传给恭亲王。1860年第二次鸦片战争期间，英法两国的接二连三的胜利使皇帝及其内廷逃离北京，留下恭亲王代表皇帝签署《北平条约》，将九龙割让给英国，并允许外国大使永久驻扎在北京。恭亲王后来成为慈禧太后手下的摄政王，掌管清朝的外交部。

Song Qingling’s Former ResidenceMUSEUM
宋庆龄故居博物馆

(宋庆龄故居, Sòng Qìnglíng Gùjū; map Google map; %010 6402 3195; 46 Houhai Beiyan, 后海北沿46号; ¥20; h9am-5.30pm Apr-Oct, to 4.30pm Nov-Mar; bLine 2 to Jishuitan, exit B)
（ 宋庆龄故居 ，Sòng Qìnglíng Gùjū; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6402 3195; 后海北沿 46 号， 后海北沿 46 号 ; ¥20; h 4 月至 10 月上午 9 点至下午 5：30,11 月至 3 月下午 4：30; b 2 号线到吉水潭，B 出口）

Set in well-tended gardens on the north shore of Houhai Lake, this is the mansion of Madam Song, venerated by the Chinese as the wife of Sun Yatsen, first president of the Republic of China. The buildings preserve her stylish living quarters, an ‘ideal home’ of 1970s China, while an attached museum takes visitors through the story of her astonishing life.
坐落在后海湖北岸精心照料的花园中，这是宋夫人的宅邸，被中国人尊为中华民国第一任总统孙中山的妻子。这些建筑保留了她时尚的居住区，这是 1970 年代中国的“理想家园”，而附属的博物馆则带领游客了解她惊人的一生。

Deshengmen Arrow TowerFORTRESS
德胜门箭塔 FORTRESS

(德胜门箭楼, Déshèngmén Jiànlóu; map Google map; 19 Xinjiekouwai Dajie, 新街口外大街19号; ¥20; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun; bLine 2, 8 to Guloudajie, exit A1)
（ 德胜门箭楼 ， Déshèngmén Jiànlóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;19 Xinjiekouwai Dajie， 新街口外大街 19 号 ; ¥20; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 2、8 号线至古娄达界，A1 出口）

A monumental landmark along the 2nd Ring Rd is this surviving hulk of Beijing’s dearly departed ramparts. A jiànlóu (arrow tower), it would have stood in front of the gate and walls itself, guarding the northern approach to the city. Today it’s easy to forget that Beijing, situated on a flat, dusty plain, was once defined by its awe-inspiring, seemingly impregnable walls. Gazing up at mighty Deshengmen at least imparts a fleeting sense of that vanished majesty.
二环路沿线的一个纪念性地标是北京已故城墙的这座幸存的废墟。它是一个 jiànlóu（箭塔），它应该矗立在大门和城墙本身的前面，守卫着通往城市的北面通道。今天，人们很容易忘记，北京坐落在一片平坦、尘土飞扬的平原上，曾经以其令人敬畏、看似坚不可摧的城墙而著称。仰望强大的德胜门，至少给人一种转瞬即逝的威严感。

You can climb the the battlements if you buy a ticket for the Beijing Ancient Coins Museum. The tower itself houses a smart little exhibition of weaponry and old photographs between the square firing embrasures.
如果你买了北京古钱币博物馆的门票，你可以爬上城垛。塔本身在方形射击炮眼之间设有一个巧妙的武器和旧照片展览。

The original Ming dynasty tower was rebuilt in 1902 after it was destroyed by allied forces following the Boxer Rebellion. The current edifice is a 1951 rebuild.
原明朝塔楼在义和团运动后被盟军摧毁后于 1902 年重建。目前的建筑是 1951 年重建的。

On the north side of Deshengmen, public buses depart for the Ming Tombs (十三陵, Shísān Líng; Changchi Lu, Changping District, 昌平区昌赤路; per site ¥20-60, through ticket ¥100 Nov-Mar, ¥135 Apr-Oct; h8am-5.30pm; g872, bChangping Line to Ming Tombs) and the Badaling section of Great Wall.
在德胜门的北侧，公共巴士开往明十三陵 （ 十三陵 ，Shísān Líng; 昌平区昌赤路昌池路;11-3 月单场 20-60 日元，11 月-3 月 100 日元，4-10 月 135 日元; h 上午 8 点至下午 5.30; g 872、 b 昌平线至明陵） 和长城八达岭段。

oWhite Dagoba TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 白达戈巴寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(妙应寺白塔, Miàoyīng Sì Báitǎ; map Google map; %010 6616 0211; 171 Fuchengmennei Dajie, 阜成门内大街171号; adult ¥20; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun; bLine 2 to Fuchengmen, exit B, or Line 4 to Xisi, exit A)
（ 妙应寺白塔 ， Miàoyīng Sì Báitǎ; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6616 0211;阜成门内大街 171 号， 阜成门内大街 171 号 ;成人 20 元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点; b 2 号线到阜城门，B 出口，或 4 号线到西西，A 出口）

Originally built in 1271 under the reign of Kublai Khan, the serene Miaoying Temple slumbers beneath its astonishing 51m-high dagoba, the tallest in China. A glimpse of it rising imperiously above the surrounding hutong is one of the most emotive sights in Beijing. The dagoba was built on the site of an earlier temple by a Nepali architect, invited to Dadu (as Beijing was known) by the Khan to cement the new dynasty’s relations with Tibet.
宁静的妙英寺始建于 1271 年忽必烈统治时期，静谧地沉睡在中国最高的 51 米高的令人惊叹的大哥坝下。瞥见它傲慢地耸立在周围的衚衕之上，是北京最感人的景象之一。 达戈巴是由一位尼泊尔建筑师在早期寺庙的遗址上建造的，他被可汗邀请到大都（北京的称呼），以巩固新王朝与西藏的关系。

You can’t enter the dagoba itself, but you can circumnavigate the base and explore the temple halls, the largest of which, the Hall of the Great Enlightened One (大觉宝殿, Dàjué Bǎodiàn), contains a display of Buddhist statuary. The Hall of the Seven Buddhas houses scale models presenting the Yuan dynasty cities of Dadu (Beijing), Shangdu (‘Xanadu’ of Coleridge’s famous poem) and Zhongdu, another Yuan-era city between the other two.
您无法进入大哥坝本身，但您可以绕过基地并探索寺庙大殿，其中最大的大觉宝殿（大觉宝殿 ，Dàjué Bǎodiàn）展示了佛教雕像。 七佛殿收藏了展示元代城市大都（北京）、上都（柯勒律治名诗中的“世外桃源”）和中都（介于另外两者之间的另一个元时代城市）的比例模型。

The hutong to the north and east of the temple are some of the more atmospheric in the city, and are well worth a stroll after your visit.
寺庙北部和东部的衚衕是这座城市中比较大气的，参观后非常值得漫步。

Lu Xun MuseumMUSEUM
鲁迅博物馆 MUSEUM

(鲁迅博物馆, Lǔ Xùn Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %010 6616 4080; www.luxunmuseum.com.cn; 19 Gongmenkou Ertiao, 宫门口二条19号; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun; bLine 2 to Fuchengmen, exit B) F
（ 鲁迅博物馆 ，Lǔ Xùn Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6616 4080;www.luxunmuseum.com.cn;19 宫门口二条 19 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 2 号线到阜城门，B 出口） F

This modern, two-storey museum presents in great detail the life of Lu Xun (1881–1936), considered the greatest Chinese writer of the 20th century. Preserved here is his small courtyard home where he lived for three years from 1924, during which time he witnessed the student massacre of 18 March 1926, and wrote his famous essay Rose Without a Flower. Passport required for entry.
这座现代化的两层博物馆非常详细地展示了鲁迅（1881-1936）的生平，鲁迅被认为是 20 世纪最伟大的中国作家。这里保存着他的小院子，他从 1924 年开始在那里住了三年，在此期间，他目睹了 1926 年 3 月 18 日的学生大屠杀，并写下了他的著名文章 《没有花的玫瑰》。 入境需要护照。

Wansong Laoren PagodaPAGODA
万松老人塔宝塔

(万松老人塔, Wàn Sōng Lǎorén Tǎ; map Google map; 43 Xisi Nandajie, 西四南大街43号; h9am-9pm; bLine 4 to Xisi, exit D) F
（ 万松老人塔 ，Wàn Sōng Lǎorén Tǎ; 地图谷歌地图 ; 西四南大街西四南大街西西南大街 43 号 h 9am-9pm; b 4 号线到西西，D 出口） F

Dating back to the Mongol Yuan dynasty but partially rebuilt in the 1980s, this nine-tiered brick pagoda sits in a lovely walled garden of pomegranate trees and grapevines, with a hotchpotch of historic hutong timber frames and stone carvings scattered about. A bookshop sells old postcards and pots of jasmine tea.
这座九层砖塔的历史可以追溯到蒙古元朝，但在 1980 年代进行了部分重建，坐落在一个由石榴树和葡萄藤组成的可爱围墙花园中，散落着历史悠久的衚衕木框架和石雕。一家书店出售旧明信片和罐装茉莉花茶。

Cathedral of Our SaviourCATHEDRAL
救世主大教堂 CATHEDRAL

(西什库天主堂, Xīshíkù Tiānzhǔtáng; map Google map; %010 6617 5198; 33 Xishiku Dajie, 西什库大街33号; h5am-6pm; bLine 4 to Xisi, exit B)
（ 西什库天主堂 ，Xīshíkù Tiānzhǔtáng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6617 5198;西什库大街西石库大街 33 号 h 5am-6pm; b 4 号线到西西，B 出口）

Formerly known as Beitang, this Gothic church (c 1897) is Beijing’s most exemplary, with a pair of 31m-high bell towers looking resplendent (read: gaudy) after a 2018 paint job. The church yard, where hawkers sell cherubic portraits of Jesus, has several notable Chinesestyle buildings providing contrast to the European architecture. Notoriously, Beitang was the site of a bloody siege during the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, costing the lives of around 400 churchgoers. A tiny memorial stone in the east chapel records the dates.
这座哥特式教堂（约1897年）前身为北塘，是北京最具典范的教堂，两座31米高的钟楼在2018年粉刷后看起来金碧辉煌（读作：华丽）。教堂院子里的小贩出售耶稣的小天使肖像，有几座著名的中式建筑，与欧洲建筑形成鲜明对比。臭名昭著的是，北塘是 1900 年义和团运动期间血腥围困的地点，导致大约 400 名教堂信徒丧生。东礼拜堂上的一块小纪念石记录了日期。

Inscribed on the stone is ‘Gesta Dei Per Francos’, an oblique reference to the First Crusade (the Boxer Rebellion was an uprising against the spread of foreign ideas in China, especially Christianity). Beneath is recorded the dates of the siege, from 13 June to 16 August 1900. During this time, something like 10,000 Boxers surrounded the church, which was protected by just 41 French and Italian marines. By digging tunnels and planting improvised mines, the Boxers killed hundreds inside the church, with many also dying of disease and starvation, but remarkably it was never taken. The number of Boxers killed is unrecorded, but was undoubtedly high (they believed they were impervious to bullets). The siege was eventually relieved by the arrival of Allied soldiers.
石头上刻着“Gesta Dei Per Francos”，隐晦地指的是第一次十字军东征（义和团运动是一场反对外国思想在中国传播的起义，尤其是基督教）。下面记录了围攻的日期，从 1900 年 6 月 13 日到 8 月 16 日。在此期间，大约 10,000 名义和团包围了这座教堂，而教堂只有 41 名法国和意大利海军陆战队员保护。通过挖掘隧道和埋设简易地雷，义和团在教堂内杀死了数百人，许多人也死于疾病和饥饿，但值得注意的是，它从未被占领。被杀的拳击手人数没有记录，但无疑很高（他们认为自己不受子弹影响）。盟军士兵的到来最终解除了围困。

Capital MuseumMUSEUM
首都博物馆 MUSEUM

(首都博物馆, Shǒudū Bówùguǎn; %010 6339 3339; www.capitalmuseum.org.cn; 16 Fuxingmenwai Dajie, 复兴门外大街16号; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLine 1 to Muxidi, exit C1) F
（ 首都博物馆 ，Shǒudū Bówùguǎn; % 010 6339 3339;www.capitalmuseum.org.cn;复兴门外大街 16 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 时至下午 5 时，最后入场时间为下午 4 时; b 1 号线到木溪地，C1 出口） F

It’s a case of ‘so near and yet so far’ for Beijing’s flagship museum, which, on architecture alone, promises so much. A neat timeline exhibit charts the history of Beijing from the Jin dynasty to the 20th century via artefacts and diorama rooms, while galleries of porcelain and Buddhist art are also nicely presented. Elsewhere, though, it’s mostly style over substance, with an entire floor given over to poorly explained folk customs and a faux, recreated hutong, which pales next to the real thing.
对于北京的旗舰博物馆来说，这是一个“如此近又又如此遥远”的案例，仅就建筑而言，它就承诺了很多。一个整洁的时间线展览通过文物和立体模型室描绘了北京从金代到 20 世纪的历史，而瓷器和佛教艺术画廊也得到了很好的展示。不过，在其他地方，它主要是风格而不是实质，整个地板都被解释得不清楚的民间习俗和一个假的、重新制作的衚衕 ，与真品相比相形见绌。

You’ll need your passport for entry. English is mostly limited to captions, so pick up an audio guide.
您需要护照才能入境。英语主要限于字幕，因此请选择语音导览。

White Cloud TempleTAOIST TEMPLE
白云寺道观

(白云观, Báiyún Guān; %010 6346 3887; 9 Baiyunguan Jie, 白云路白云观街9号; ¥10; h8.30am-4.30pm May-early Oct, to 4pm early Oct-Apr; bLine 1 to Muxidi, exit C1)
（ 白云观 ，Báiyún Guān; % 010 6346 3887; 白云路白云观街 9 号 ; ¥10; h 5 月至 10 月初上午 8.30 至下午 4.30,10 月初至 4 月初至下午 4 点; b 1 号线到木溪地，C1 出口）

White Cloud Temple is an active, vast and fascinating maze of halls, shrines and brightly painted immortals, tended by Taoist monks with their hair gathered into topknots. It was first established in 741, and was a particularly prestigious centre for Taoism during the Mongol Yuan dynasty, though most of the temple halls are fairly recent rebuilds.
白云寺是一个活跃、广阔而迷人的迷宫，由大殿、神社和色彩鲜艳的仙人组成，由道士照料，他们的头发扎成顶髻。它始建于 741 年，是蒙古元朝时期特别负盛名的道教中心，尽管大多数寺庙大厅都是最近重建的。

Grab a free box of incense sticks at the entrance. These are to be lit (in multiples of three) at burners stationed outside the 19 halls, whose attendant deities ascend in order of rank up to the Hall of the Three Pure Ones (San Qing), a 2nd-floor shrine containing statues of Taoism’s three holiest figures, regarded as the origin of all beings.
在入口处免费拿一盒香。这些将在 19 个大厅外的燃烧器上点燃（以 3 的倍数），其随从的神灵按等级顺序上升到三清殿 （三清），这是一座二楼的神龛，里面有道教三圣人物的雕像，被视为众生的起源。

Head east from the subway exit, past the hulking Capital Museum then turn right on Baiyun Lu. After crossing the canal, take the second left (Baiyunguan Jie).
从地铁出口向东行驶，经过庞大的首都博物馆 ，然后右转进入白云路。过运河后，在第二个路口左转（白云关街）。

WORTH A TRIP
值得一游

THE MING TOMBS
明十三陵

Cradled by Tianshou Mountain in Beijing’s northern reaches are the tombs of 13 Ming dynasty emperors (十三陵, Shísān Líng), arranged according to feng shui across a lush valley once sealed off to the living by an 80km wall.
北京北部的天寿山背靠着十三陵，是明朝十三陵（ 十三陵 ，世山陵）的陵墓，根据风水排列在郁郁葱葱的山谷上，曾经被 80 公里的围墙封闭起来。

Despite not generally being considered a ‘must-see’ like the Great Wall or the Forbidden City, the Ming Tombs can be an incredibly rewarding place to visit on a quiet day in fine weather, beginning with a stroll along the Spirit Way between its solemn guard of stone beasts and officials, before exploring the first and largest of the tombs, the Yong Ling, boasting architecture that easily rivals the Forbidden City. At Ding Ling you can descend into the tomb itself, though the experience isn’t as exciting as it sounds, being mostly empty and without ornament.
尽管明十三陵通常不像长城或紫禁城那样被认为是“必游之地”，但在天气晴朗的安静日里，明十三陵可以是一个非常有益的地方，首先沿着庄严的石兽守卫和官员之间的灵道漫步，然后探索第一个也是最大的陵墓， 永陵 ，拥有轻松与紫禁城相媲美的建筑。在丁陵 ，您可以下到坟墓本身，尽管这种体验并不像听起来那么令人兴奋，大部分时间都是空的，没有装饰品。

Aside from the Zhao Ling, the other 10 tombs are fenced off, and best viewed from afar when standing atop the burial mound citadels at each of the three accessible tombs. That said, the hillsides here would reward the intrepid hiker with incredible views of the tomb sites spread over 40 sq km of fields, orchards, rivers and scattered villages.
除了昭陵外，其他 10 座墓葬都被围起来，最好站在三座可进入的墓葬的坟墓顶部，从远处观看。也就是说，这里的山坡会奖励勇敢的徒步旅行者，欣赏到占地 40 多平方公里的田野、果园、河流和分散村庄的墓地遗址的壮丽景色。

The most direct way to get there is on bus 872 (¥9, one hour, 7.10am to 7.10pm), which departs from the north side of Deshengmen Arrow Tower. It calls at the Spirit Way and Ding Ling, before terminating at Chang Ling. The last bus back is at 6pm.
最直接的交通方式是乘坐872路公交车（9日元，一小时，早上7点10分到晚上7点10分），从德胜门箭塔北侧出发。它停靠灵道和丁灵，然后终止于长岭。最后一班车回程是下午 6 点。

HUTONG TODAY
今天的胡同

From around 3200 in 1949, the number of intact hutong lanes was thought to have shrunk to 900 by 2012 as new office buildings, apartment blocks and the widening of roads prompted widespread demolition. More alarming is that in 2017 some sources put the number of hutong at just 300, with about half truncated or changed in part by construction.
由于新的办公楼、公寓楼和道路拓宽促使大面积拆除，完整的衚衕巷的数量被认为从 1949 年的 3200 条左右减少到 2012 年的 900 条。更令人担忧的是，2017 年，一些消息来源称衚衕数量仅为 300 座，其中大约一半因建设而被截断或部分改变。

Temple of Heaven Park & Dongcheng South
