1Temple of Heaven Park & Dongcheng South
天 1 坛公园和东城南

oTemple of Heaven ParkPARK
o 天坛公园 PARK

(天坛公园, Tiāntán Gōngyuán; map Google map; %010 6702 9917; Tiantan Donglu, 天坛东路; park/through ticket Apr-Oct ¥15/35, Nov-Mar ¥10/30, audio guide ¥40, deposit ¥50; hpark 6.30am-10pm, sights 8am-5.30pm Apr-Oct, park 6.30am-8pm, sights 8am-5pm Nov-Mar; bLine 5 to Tiantandongmen, exit A)
（ 天坛公园 ，Tiāntán Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6702 9917;天坛东路， 天坛东路 ;4-10 月 15/35 日，11-3 月 10/30 日，语音导览 40 日元，押金 50 日元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 6.30 至晚上 10 点公园，景点上午 8 点至下午 5.30,11 月至 3 月上午 6.30 至晚上 8 点，景点上午 8 点至下午 5 点; b 5 号线至天潭东门，A 出口）

An oasis of methodical Confucian design, the 267-hectare Temple of Heaven Park is unique. It originally served as a vast stage for solemn rites performed by the emperor (the literal ‘Son of Heaven’), who prayed here for good harvests at winter solstice and sought divine clearance and atonement. Since 1918 this private imperial domain has opened its gates to common folk, who still congregate daily to perform taichi, twirl on gymnastics bars and sing revolutionary songs en masse.
占地 267 公顷的天坛公园是一片儒家设计有条不紊的绿洲，独一无二。它最初是皇帝（字面意思是“天子”）举行庄严仪式的广阔舞台，皇帝在冬至在这里祈求丰收，并寻求神圣的许可和赎罪。自 1918 年以来，这个私人帝国领地向平民敞开了大门，他们仍然每天聚集在一起表演太极拳，在体栏上旋转，集体演唱革命歌曲。

Don’t expect to see worshippers at prayer; this is not so much a temple as a place of arcane, Confucian-inspired statecraft. The emperor, the Son of Heaven (天子, Tiānzǐ), visited the Temple of Heaven twice a year, with the more important ceremony performed at winter solstice. The royal entourage proceeded from the Forbidden City to the Imperial Vault of Heaven map Google map (皇穹宇, Huáng Qióng Yǔ) in silence, with commoners instructed to close all windows and remain indoors. The procession included elephant and horse chariots and long lines of lancers, nobles, officials and musicians. The imperial sedan chair was 12m long, 3m wide and employed 10 bearers.
不要指望看到敬拜者在祈祷;与其说这是一座寺庙，不如说是一个神秘的、受儒家启发的治国之道的地方。天子（ 天子 ，Tiānzǐ）每年两次参拜天坛，更重要的仪式在冬至举行。皇家随行人员从紫禁城默默地前往皇穹宇地图谷歌地图 ， 平民被指示关闭所有窗户并留在室内。游行队伍包括大象和马车以及长长的枪骑兵、贵族、官员和音乐家。御轿长 12 米，宽 3 米，雇用 10 名搬运工。

Although there are four main entry points to the park (with the east and west gates most convenient for visitors; through tickets cannot be purchased after 4pm), the imperial approach was via Zhaoheng Gate (天坛南门, Tiāntán Nánmén) in the south leading directly to the Round Altar map Google map (圜丘, Yuán Qiū). On this open-air, raised dais the ceremonies to heaven took place, performed according to solemn protocol every winter solstice by the emperor himself.
虽然公园有四个主要入口（东门和西门对游客最方便，下午 4 点后无法购买直通票），但御道是通过南面的天坛南门（天坛南门 ，Tiāntán Nánmén）， 直接通往圆坛地图 Google map（ 圜丘 ，Yuán Qiū）.在这个露天、高架的讲台上，每年冬至都按照庄严的礼仪举行了上天的仪式，由皇帝亲自举行。

Arranged in three tiers, the Round Altar revolves around the imperial number nine. Odd numbers were considered sacrosanct in imperial China – nine (jiǔ) is the highest single-digit odd number and a homonym for long life. The altar is arranged in three tiers, with the top tier containing nine rings of stones, arranged in multiples of nine. The stairs and balustrades are also multiples of nine.
圆形祭坛分为三层，围绕着帝国数字九号旋转。奇数在中国帝国被认为是神圣不可侵犯的——九（jiǔ）是最高的个位数奇数，也是长寿的谐音。祭坛分为三层，顶层有九环石，以九的倍数排列。楼梯和栏杆也是 9 的倍数。

North of the Round Altar is the Imperial Vault of Heaven (皇穹宇, Huáng Qióng Yǔ), enclosed by a low circular wall known as the Echo Wall map Google map (回音壁, Huíyīn Bì). Despite its splendid, shapely appearance, the Vault of Heaven was a storeroom, used to keep the spirit tablets of the gods and other materials needed for the ceremonies on the Round Altar. Seen from above the structures of the Temple of Heaven are round and their bases square, a pattern deriving from the ancient Chinese belief that heaven is round and earth is square.
圆坛以北是皇穹宇（皇穹宇 ，Huáng Qióng Yǔ）， 周围环绕着一堵低矮的圆形墙，称为回音壁地图谷歌地图 （ 回音壁 ，Huíyīn Bì）。 尽管穹顶外观华丽匀称，但它是一个储藏室，用于在圆坛上存放众神的灵牌和仪式所需的其他材料。从上面看，天坛的结构是圆形的，底座是方形的，这种模式源于中国古代的天圆地方的信仰。

The Echo Wall (回音壁, Huíyīn Bì), 65m in diameter, is so named for its unique acoustic properties. A quiet word or two spoken a few feet from the wall can be heard at the opposite point on the circle (although the din of other tourists chattering can drown it out!). Continuing on from the Imperial Vault of Heaven is the majestic, 360m-long Red Stairway Bridge map Google map (丹陛桥, Dānbì Qiáo; Imperial Walkway), an imperial thoroughfare leading to the marvellous centrepiece of the Temple of Heaven, the Hall of Prayer for Good Harvests map Google map (祈年殿, Qínián Diàn; h8am-5pm).
回音壁 （ 回音壁 ，Huíyīn Bì） 直径 65 米，因其独特的声学特性而得名。在圆圈的对面可以听到离墙几英尺远的一两句安静的话（尽管其他游客喋喋不休的喧闹声会淹没它！从御穹继续前行，是雄伟的 360 米长的红阶桥地图谷歌地图 （ 丹陛桥 ，Dānbì Qiáo;Imperial Walkway）， 一条通往天坛奇妙中心、祈丰年殿地图的皇家大道 Google map（ 祈年殿 ，Qínián Diàn; h 上午 8 点至下午 5 点）。

A much-photographed icon, the triple-eaved Hall of Prayer for Good Harvests is made entirely of wood without the use of nails, with the heavy roof supported by 28 wooden pillars. First built around 1420, it was burnt to cinders by a lightning strike in 1889. A faithful reproduction based on Ming architectural methods was erected the following year, with timber imported from the USA, since by that point China lacked trees big enough for the task. Rich in esoteric symbolism, the four largest central pillars represent the seasons, the 12 in the next ring the months of the year, and the 12 outermost columns represent the day, broken into 12 ‘watches’ of two hours each. Writhing about on the ceiling is a vivid dragon-phoenix relief, representing the emperor and empress.
三层檐的丰收祈祷堂是一个备受拍照的标志，它完全由木头制成，没有使用钉子，厚重的屋顶由 28 根木柱支撑。它始建于 1420 年左右，1889 年被雷击烧成灰烬。次年，根据明代建筑方法的忠实复制品，木材从美国进口，因为那时中国缺乏足够大的树木来完成这项任务。四根最大的中央柱子代表季节，下一个环中的 12 根柱子代表一年中的月份，最外层的 12 根柱子代表一天，分为 12 个“手表”，每个手表两个小时。天花板上扭动的是生动的龙凤浮雕，代表着皇帝和皇后。

Connected to the Hall of Prayer for Good Harvests by the ornamental Long Corridor map Google map (七十二长廊, Qīshí’èr Chángláng), the Animal Killing Pavilion map Google map (宰牲亭, Zǎishēng Tíng) was where oxen, sheep, deer and other beasts were slaughtered and prepared before being presented as divine offerings. You’ll need to show you passport to get a look in at the copper boilers and cleaning sink on display.
与祈丰堂相连，有观赏长廊地图谷歌地图 （ 七十二长廊 ，Qīshí'èr Chángláng）， 杀兽亭地图谷歌地图 （ 宰牲亭 ，Zǎishēng Tíng） 是牛、羊、鹿和其他野兽在作为神祭献上之前被宰杀和准备的地方。您需要出示护照才能查看展出的铜锅炉和清洁水槽。

To the west of the park, the Divine Music Administration map Google map (神乐署, Shényuè Shǔ; ¥10; h9am-4pm) is where the ranks of drummers, pipers and bellringers got their act together prior to the imperial ceremonies. Now a museum, exhibits cast light on zhōnghé sháolè (中和韶乐), the ceremonial music reserved for the imperial court, and there are galleries devoted to ancient Chinese musical instruments. Adjacent to the West Heavenly Gate map Google map (西天门, Xītiān Mén), the Fasting Palace map Google map (斋宫, Zhāi Gōng) F is where the emperor hunkered down in preparation for the winter solstice ceremony, abstaining from all earthly pleasures for a day or two. Resembling a Forbidden City in miniature, it’s surrounded by a moat and has its own Drum and Bell Tower. You’ll need your passport for entry.
公园西边， 神乐署地图谷歌地图 （ 神乐署 ，Shényuè Shǔ;¥10; h 上午 9 点至下午 4 点）是鼓手、风笛手和敲钟手在皇家仪式之前聚集在一起的地方。现在是一座博物馆，展品展示了宫廷保留的礼乐“中韶乐 ”， 还有专门展示中国古代乐器的画廊。毗邻西天门地图谷歌地图 （ 西天门 ，Xītiān Mén）， 斋宫地图谷歌地图（ 斋宫 ，Zhāi Gōng） F 是皇帝蹲下准备冬至仪式的地方，一两天内戒除一切尘世的享乐。它就像一座缩影的紫禁城，周围环绕着护城河，并拥有自己的鼓楼和钟楼。您需要护照才能入境。

Since 1918 the Temple of Heaven has opened its gates to Beijing’s laobaoxing (old ‘hundred names’ – literally common folk). Among the 4000 or so knotted cypresses, you’ll see locals performing taichi, kung-fu routines, dancing, or assembling into impromptu choirs and orchestras to belt out the old revolutionary songs with gusto. The exercise area in the northeast of the park has some of Beijing’s best people-watching, where you might catch sight of a septuagenarian twirling on gymnastics bars, and other feats of athleticism.
自 1918 年以来，天坛向北京的老堡星 （旧的“百名”——字面意思是普通民间）敞开了大门。在大约 4000 棵打结的柏树中，您会看到当地人表演太极拳、功夫套路、跳舞，或者即兴合唱团和管弦乐队兴致勃勃地高唱古老的革命歌曲。公园东北部的健身区拥有北京最好的人群观察场所，在那里您可能会看到一个七十多岁的老人在体杆上旋转，以及其他运动壮举。

oSoutheast Corner WatchtowerWATCHTOWER
o 东南角 守望台 WATCHTOWER

(东南角楼, Dōngnán Jiǎolóu; map Google map; 9 Chongwenmen Dondajie, 崇文门东大街9号; ¥10; h8am-5pm; bJianguomen or Chongwenmen)
（ 东南角楼 ，Dōngnán Jiǎolóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;9 崇文门东大街， 崇文门东大街 9 号 ; ¥10; h 上午 8 点至下午 5 点; b 建国门或崇文门）

This immense fortress, part of the Ming City Wall Ruins Park, guarded the southeast corner of Beijing’s city walls. Built in 1439 but repaired numerous times over the centuries, the tower is skewered with a formidable grid of 144 archery embrasures to rain fire on would-be attackers. Visitors can mount the battlements and explore the tower itself, a magnificent maze of carpentry over multiple floors, including an exhibition of historic photographs.
这座巨大的堡垒是明城墙遗址公园的一部分，守卫着北京城墙的东南角。这座塔建于 1439 年，但几个世纪以来经过多次修复，上面串着由 144 个射箭孔组成的强大网格，可以向潜在的攻击者开火。游客可以登上城垛并探索塔本身，这是一个横跨多层楼的宏伟木工迷宫，包括历史照片展览。

From the ramparts, you can photograph the remains of the city wall as it flows west, while trainspotters can admire the rolling stock grinding in and out of Beijing Railway Station. Keep an eye out for graffiti scratched into the tower by American and Russian soldiers during the Boxer Rebellion in 1900. Allied forces overwhelmed the redoubt after a lengthy engagement (during which it was heavily damaged), en route to relieving the besieged Legation Quarter.
从城墙上，您可以拍摄城墙向西流动的遗迹，而火车观察者则可以欣赏进出北京火车站的机车车辆。留意 1900 年义和团运动期间美国和俄罗斯士兵在塔上划伤的涂鸦。盟军在经过长时间的交战（期间遭到严重破坏）后压倒了堡垒，以解救被围困的公使馆区。

Ming City Wall Ruins ParkWALLS
明城墙遗址公园 WALLS

(明城墙遗址公园, Míng Chéngqiáng Yízhǐ Gōng-yuán; map Google map; Chongwenmen Dongdajie, 崇文門东大街; h24hr; bLines 2, 5 to Chongwenmen, exit F) F
（ 明城墙遗址公园 ， Míng Chéngqiáng Yízhǐ Gōng-yuán; 地图谷歌地图 ;崇文门东大街， 崇文门东大街 h 24hr; b 2、5 号线至崇文门，F 出口） F

This wistful stretch of brick and stone is all that remains (besides a couple of other denuded nubs) of Beijing’s once formidable city walls that girded the capital from the early Ming dynasty. The walls have been dismantled piecemeal since the 1950s, making way for the 2nd Ring Rd and Line 2 of the Beijing subway. A park at the wall’s base makes for a pleasant stroll through the past.
这片令人思念的砖石是北京曾经从明朝初期开始环绕首都的强大城墙的全部遗迹（除了其他几个裸露的小块）。自 1950 年代以来，这些墙壁被零碎拆除，为北京地铁二环路和 2 号线让路。城墙底部的公园让您愉快地漫步过去。

In 1996 this scrap of wall, concealed by weeds and being used as a rear wall for buildings, was to be removed to make way for a hotel. When it was realised the remains were largely Ming in origin, it was instead preserved. The Beijing Evening News ran a ‘donate bricks’ campaign, asking residents to return original wall bricks that had been repurposed for other uses, to aid in the restoration. In total over 30,000 Ming and Qing bricks were received, and 2700 residents relocated.
1996 年，这堵被杂草遮挡并用作建筑物后墙的墙将被拆除，为酒店让路。当人们意识到这些遗骸主要起源于明朝时，它反而被保存下来。《 北京晚报 》开展了“捐赠砖块”活动，要求居民归还被重新用于其他用途的原有墙砖，以帮助修复。总共收到了 30,000 多块明清砖，2700 名居民搬迁。

The park also contains a restored signal house of the old Beijing–Fengtian Railway, which ran just outside the city walls here.
公园内还有一座经过修复的旧京奉铁路信号房，该铁路就在这里城墙外运行。

China Railway Museum – Zhengyang GateMUSEUM
中国铁路博物馆 – 正阳门博物馆

(中国铁道博物馆, Zhōngguó Tiědào Bówùguǎn; map; %010 6705 1638; 2a Qianmen Dongdajie, 前门东大街2a号; ¥20; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit B)
（ 中国铁道博物馆 ， Zhōngguó Tiědào Bówùguǎn; 地图 ; % 010 6705 1638; 前门东大街 2a 号， 前门东大街 2a 号 ; ¥20; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点; b 2 号线到前门，B 出口）

In the old Qianmen Railway Station, which served Beijing from 1906 to 1959 (although only the clock tower is original), this museum offers a fairly uninspired retelling of the development of the capital and of China’s railway system, with plenty of photos and models, but few English captions.
在1906年至1959年为北京服务的旧前门火车站（尽管只有钟楼是原来的），这座博物馆对首都和中国铁路系统的发展进行了相当平淡的重述，有大量的照片和模型，但很少有英文说明。

A lack of space means it doesn’t have many actual trains, although you can clamber into the cab of a life-sized model of China’s high-speed trains. Hardcore trainspotters should make tracks to its sister museum on the northeastern outskirts of Beijing, which is vast and filled to the brim with historic locos.
空间不足意味着它没有很多实际的火车，尽管你可以爬进中国高速列车真人大小模型的驾驶室。铁杆火车观察者应该前往位于北京东北郊的姊妹博物馆 ，那里面积广阔，到处都是历史悠久的机车。

Qianmen AvenueSTREET
前门大道 STREET

(前门大街, Qiánmén Dàjiē; map Google map; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit C)
（ 前门大街 ， Qiánmén Dàjiē; 地图谷歌地图 ; b 2 号线到前门，C 出口）

Running due south from Beijing’s ‘front gate’, the mighty Qianmen (前门, Front Gate; Zhèngyáng Mén; map; Tian’anmen Sq; ¥20, audio guide ¥20; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit B or C), this street was once the main commercial thoroughfare through what was known as the ‘Chinese City’, where non-Manchu were permitted to reside during the Qing dynasty. Razed and rebuilt for the 2008 Olympics, it’s character has now changed, with mock-period frontages housing international shopping brands, tour-group restaurants and a touristy tram ride.
从北京的“前门”向南延伸，威风凛凛的前门 （ 前门 ，前门;Zhèngyáng Mén; 地图 ;天安门广场;20 日元，语音导览 20 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 2 号线到前门，B 或 C 出口）， 这条街曾经是通经所谓的“中国城市”的主要商业通道，清朝时期允许非满族人居住。它为 2008 年奥运会而被夷为平地并重建，现在它的特征已经发生了变化，模拟时期的临街面设有国际购物品牌、旅游团体餐厅和旅游电车。

At the northern end, 2019’s Beijing Fun is a stylish shopping complex, which has at least attempted to preserve several handsome old buildings within its footprint.
在北端，2019 年的北京欢乐是一个时尚的购物中心，它至少试图在其占地面积内保留几座漂亮的老建筑。

LOCAL KNOWLEDGE
当地知识

MARTIAL ARTS
武道

The serene woodland in the south of Temple of Heaven Park is where you’ll encounter the most graceful practitioners of taichi, along with other Chinese martial arts – go early. For something more flashy, Red Theatre (红剧场, Hóng Jùchǎng; map Google map; %010 6714 2473; 44 Xingfu Dajie, 幸福大街44号; tickets ¥140-600; hperformances 7.30pm; bLine 5 to Tiantandongmen, exit B), 1km east of the park, stages The Legend of Kung Fu, a daily stage show with slick, high-energy fight scenes.
天坛公园南边宁静的林地是你会遇到最优雅的太极拳练习者以及其他中国武术的地方——早点去。如果想更华丽的，红色剧场 （ 红剧场 ，Hóng Jùchǎng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6714 2473; 幸福大街 44 号幸福大街 44 号 ; 门票¥140-600; h 演出晚上 7 点 30 分; b 5 号线到天潭东门， 在公园以东 1 公里处的 B）出口，上演《 功夫传奇 》，这是一场日常舞台表演，打斗场面流畅、充满活力。

Dashilar Commercial StreetAREA
达希拉尔商业街区

(大栅栏商业街, Dàshìlàn Shāngyè Jiē; map Google map; Dazhalan Jie, 大栅栏街; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit B or C)
（ 大栅栏商业街 ， Dàshìlàn Shāngyè Jiē; 地图谷歌地图 ;大栅栏街 b 2 号线至前门，B 或 C 出口）

This centuries-old shopping street, although tarted up for tourists, retains several timeworn emporia selling silk, cloth shoes and traditional Chinese medicine (同仁堂; %010 6303 1155; 24 Dashilan Jie, 大栅栏街24号; h8am-8pm). Once part of a vice-infested enclave of opera theatres, opium dens and bordellos west of Qianmen Dajie, it was put to the torch during the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, and subsequently rebuilt during the Republic of China.
这条拥有百年历史的商店街虽然是为游客而设的，但保留着几家陈旧的商店 ， 出售丝绸 、 布鞋和中药 （ 同仁堂 % 010 6303 1155;大栅栏街 24 号 h 8am-8pm）。 它曾经是前门大街以西的歌剧院、鸦片馆和博尔德罗的恶习出没飞地的一部分，在 1900 年义和团运动期间被烧毁，随后在民国时期重建。

Beijing Ancient Architecture MuseumMUSEUM
北京古建筑博物馆 MUSEUM

(北京古代建筑博物馆, Běijīng Gǔdài Jiànzhú Bówùguǎn; map Google map; %010 6304 5608; 21 Dongjing Lu, 东经路21号; ¥15, audio guide ¥10; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun; bLine 8 to Tianqiao, exit D)
（ 北京古代建筑博物馆 ，Běijīng Gǔdài Jiànzhú Bówùguǎn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6304 5608; 东经路 21 号， 东经路 21 号 ; ¥15， 语音导览¥10; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 8 号线到天桥，D 出口）

On the site of the old Temple of Agriculture (先农坛, Xiānnóng Tán), you’ll find this museum exploring traditional Chinese building techniques. Brush up on your dǒugǒng (brackets) and sǔnmǎo (joints), and get the lowdown on Beijing’s courtyard houses as you explore the historic complex, centred on the magnificent Jupiter Hall (太岁殿, Tàisuì Diàn) with its fine restored ceiling.
在古老的农坛（先农坛 ，Xiānnóng Tán）的遗址上，您会发现这座探索中国传统建筑技术的博物馆。在探索这座历史建筑群的同时，温习一下你的 dǒugǒng（括号）和 sǔnmǎo（关节），了解北京的四合院的内幕，以宏伟的木星殿 （ 太岁殿 ，Tàisuì Diàn）为中心，其经过精心修复的天花板。

Fayuan TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
法源寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(法源寺, Fǎyuán Sì; map Google map; 7 Fayuansi Qianjie, 法源寺前街7号; adult ¥5; h8.30-4pm; bLines 4, 7 to Caishikou, exit D)
（ 法源寺 ，Fǎyuán Sì; 地图谷歌地图 ;7 法源寺前街 7 号 ;成人 5 日元; h 下午 8.30-4 点; b 4、7 号线至菜市口 D 出口）

Infused with an air of sleepy reverence, this working Buddhist temple is one of Beijing’s most transportative. Perhaps it’s the ancient Song dynasty pines, interspersed with thickets of lilacs, gingkos and crabapple trees from the time of Emperor Qianlong, or the way monks and local retirees outnumber tourists, but bustling Beijing feels aeons away. Originally built in the 7th century to honour soldiers killed in battle with Korean tribes, the current halls are 20th-century renovations.
这座仍在运营的佛教寺庙充满了昏昏欲睡的崇敬气氛，是北京最具交通便利的寺庙之一。也许是宋代古松，点缀着乾隆皇帝时期的丁香、银杏和海棠树，也可能是僧侣和当地退休人员多于游客的方式，但繁华的北京却让人感觉很遥远。现在的大厅最初建于 7 世纪，旨在纪念在与朝鲜部落战斗中阵亡的士兵，现在的大厅是 20 世纪的翻修工程。

That being said, the courtyards contain several ancient stelae and the halls dozens of handsome Buddhist relics in glass cases. Beijing’s longest reclining Buddha at 7.4m lies supine in the rearmost hall (closed for renovations at time of research). And do seek out the Pilu Hall for its enormous stone lotus bulb engraved with ‘1000 leaves’ of Buddha images and crowned with the Five Dhyani Buddhas.
话虽如此，庭院里有几块古老的石碑，大厅里有几十件装在玻璃柜里的漂亮佛教舍利。北京最长的卧佛高 7.4 米，仰卧在最后面的大厅（在研究期间因翻修而关闭）。一定要去毗卢殿寻找它巨大的石莲花球，上面刻有“1000 片叶子”的佛像，并戴着五尊 Dhyani 佛陀。

You can be certain of seeing monks here, because Dayuan Temple also serves as as a Buddhist teaching academy, well furnished with precious religious texts stored within the Pavilion of Buddhist Sutras.
您可以肯定在这里看到僧侣，因为大渊寺也是一所佛教教学学院，佛经阁内存放着珍贵的宗教典籍。

Niu Jie MosqueMOSQUE
牛街清真寺清真寺

(牛街礼拜寺, Niú Jiē Lǐbài Sì; %010 6353 2564; 18 Niu Jie, 牛街18号; adult ¥10, Muslims free; h8am-5pm; bLine 7 to Guang’anmennei, exit D)
（ 牛街礼拜寺 ，Niú Jiē Lǐbài Sì; % 010 6353 2564; 牛街 18 号， 牛街 18 号 ; 成人 10 日元，穆斯林免费; h 上午 8 点至下午 5 点; b 7 号线到广安门内，D 出口）

Dating from around the 10th century when Chinese first began converting to Islam, Beijing’s oldest mosque appears more like a Chinese temple with Islamic characteristics. Dome and minarets are conspicuously absent, but it does have a fine prayer hall serving the local community of Hui Chinese Muslims, who also run the many halal butchers in the vicinity of Ox St (Niu Jie).
这座北京最古老的清真寺的历史可以追溯到 10 世纪左右，当时中国人首次开始皈依伊斯兰教，看起来更像是一座具有伊斯兰特色的中国寺庙。圆顶和尖塔明显缺失，但它确实有一个精美的祈祷厅，为当地的回族穆斯林社区服务，他们还在牛街（牛街）附近经营着许多清真屠夫。

OFF THE BEATEN TRACK
人迹罕至的地方

Dating back to the Liao dynasty (around 1120), the pagoda in the little-visited Tianning Temple (天宁寺; Tiānníng Sì; 3 Tianningsi Qianjie, 天宁寺前街甲3号; h9am-4pm; bLine 7 to Daguanying, exit C) is reputedly the oldest structure in Beijing. The octagonal tower stands at a majestic 57.8m tall with 13 eaves, though much of its exterior statuary has crumbled away. Tianning Temple is a 25-minute schlep from the subway, so you might consider taking a taxi.
这座宝塔的历史可以追溯到辽朝（约 1120 年），位于鲜为人知的天宁寺 （ 天宁寺 ;天宁思; 天宁寺前街甲 3 号 h 9am-4pm; b 7 号线至大观营 C）出口 ，据说是北京最古老的建筑。这座八角形塔楼高 57.8 米，有 13 个屋檐，但其大部分外部雕像已经倒塌。天宁寺距离地铁站有 25 分钟路程，因此您可以考虑乘坐出租车。

1Sanlitun & Chaoyang
1 三里屯和朝阳

o798 Art DistrictAREA
o 798 艺术区

(798 艺术区, Qī Jiǔ Bā Yìshù Qū; cnr Jiuxianqiao Lu & 798 Lu, 酒仙桥路; hgalleries 10am-6pm, most closed Mon; g403, 909, bLine 14 to Wangjing South, exit B1)
酒仙桥路 h 画廊 10am-6pm，周一闭馆 ; g 403、909、 b 14 号线至望京南 B1 出口）

Contemporary art meets communist history at this thrilling enclave of international galleries installed within China’s model factory complex of the 1950s. Most of Beijing’s best galleries are here, staging shows from the likes of Ai Weiwei and David Hockney in gorgeous Bauhaus workshops that once produced munitions and electronics. Toss into the mix oodles of street art, stylish cafes and restaurants, art shops, and an elevated walkway (D-Park; h8am-8pm) F offering views of astonishing industrial architecture, and you can easily spend a full day here.
当代艺术与共产主义历史相遇，在这个令人兴奋的国际画廊飞地，安装在 1950 年代中国的样板工厂综合体内。北京大多数最好的画廊都在这里，在曾经生产军火和电子产品的华丽包豪斯作坊里举办艾未未和大卫·霍克尼等人的展览。沉浸在街头艺术、时尚的咖啡馆和餐馆、艺术商店和高架人行道 （D-Park; h 上午 8 点至晚上 8 点）， F 可欣赏令人惊叹的工业建筑景观，您可以轻松地在这里度过一整天。

The ‘718 Joint Factory’, as 798 was originally known, was built with East German expertise in the 1950s, using materials imported from East Germany via the Trans-Siberian Railway all the way into the factory itself. Preservation orders have saved the old factory station, tracks and a steam loco, along with giant industrial chimneys, workers’ dorms and, most importantly, the light-filled Bauhaus factories and workshops, now home to galleries like 798 Art Factory (798艺术工厂, 798 Yìshù Gōngchǎng; 4 Jiuxianqiao Lu, 酒仙桥路4号) F and BTAP (东京画廊, Dōngjīng Huàláng; www.tokyo-gallery.com; off 798 Lu, 798路; h10am-5.30pm Tue-Sat) F, where scarlet slogans praising Chairman Mao are still visible on the lofty ceilings.
“718 联合工厂”，正如 798 最初所说的那样，是在 1950 年代利用东德的专业知识建造的，使用从东德通过西伯利亚大铁路一直进口到工厂本身的材料。保护令保存了旧的工厂车站、轨道和蒸汽机车，以及巨大的工业烟囱、工人宿舍，最重要的是，光线充足的包豪斯工厂和作坊，现在是 798 艺术工厂 （798 艺术工厂 ，798 Yìshù Gōngchǎng;4 Jiuxianqiao Lu， 酒仙桥路 4 号 ） F 和 BTAP（ 东京画廊 ，Dōngjīng Huàláng;www.tokyo-gallery.com;798 路，798 路 h 周二至周六上午 10 点至下午 5 点 30 分）， F 高耸的天花板上仍然可以看到赞美毛主席的猩红色标语。

The most famous gallery is UCCA (Ullens Center for Contemporary Art, 尤伦斯当代艺术中心, Yóulúnsī Dāngdài Yìshù Zhōngxīn; %010 5780 0200; www.ucca.org.cn/en; 4 Jiuxianqiao Lu, 酒仙桥路4号; ¥60-100; h10am-7pm), which usually hosts two or three big-ticket international exhibitions at a time. Faurschou Foundation (林冠艺术基金会, Línguān Yìshù Jījīnhuì; %010 5978 9316; www.faurschou.com; 2 Jiuxuanquao Lu 酒仙桥路2号) F from Denmark and the Chinese-run M Woods Art Museum (木木美术馆, Mùmù Měishùguǎn; %010 8312 3450; www.mwoods.org; 2 Jiuxuanquao Lu, 酒仙桥路2号; ¥80; h10.30am-7pm Tue-Sun) consistently stage thought-provoking exhibitions from the biggest names in art, both Chinese and international.
最著名的画廊是尤伦斯当代艺术中心尤伦斯当代艺术中心 ; % 010 5780 0200;www.ucca.org.cn/en;4 酒仙桥路 4 号 ; ¥60-100; h 上午 10 点至晚上 7 点）， 通常一次举办两到三个大型国际展览。林冠艺术基金会 （Linguān Yìshù Jījīnhuì; % 010 5978 9316;www.faurschou.com;2 Jiuxuanquao Lu 酒仙桥路 2 号 ） F 和中国经营的 M Woods Art Museum（ 木木美术馆 ，Mùmù Měishùguǎn; % 010 8312 3450;www.mwoods.org;2 Jiuxuanquao Lu， 酒仙桥路 2 号 ; ¥80; h 周二至周日上午 10：30 至晚上 7 点） 不断举办来自中国和国际艺术界知名人士的发人深省的展览。

It’s not all world class, of course; dozens of smaller galleries range from the edgy to the derivative, while on the streets, local portrait sketchers and cartoonists hawk their services to tourists.
当然，它并不全是世界级的;数十家较小的画廊从前卫到衍生，而在街上，当地的肖像素描家和漫画家向游客兜售他们的服务。

798 Art District | WALTER BIBIKOW/GETTY IMAGES ©
798 艺术区 |沃尔特·比比科夫/盖蒂图片社 ©

Dongyue TempleTAOIST TEMPLE
东岳寺道观

(东岳庙, Dōngyuè Miào; map Google map; 141 Chaoyangmenwai Dajie, 朝阳门外大街141号; ¥10; h8.30am4.30pm Tue-Sun, last entry 4pm; bLines 2, 6 to Chaoyangmen, exit A, or Line 6 to Dongdaqiao, exit A)
（ 东岳庙 ，Dōngyuè Miào; 地图谷歌地图 ;朝阳门外大街朝阳门外大街 141 号 ; ¥10; h 周二至周日上午 8：30 下午 4：30，最后入场时间下午 4 点; b 2、6 号线到朝阳门 A 出口，或 6 号线到东大桥 A 出口）

Dedicated to the Eastern Peak (Tài Shān) of China’s five Taoist mountains, this morbid Taoist shrine is an unsettling, albeit entertaining, place of worship. The highlight is the series of comically macabre diorama cubicles representing various ‘departments’ from the Taoist underworld.
这座病态的道教圣地供奉着中国五座道教山的东峰（太山），是一个令人不安但有趣的礼拜场所。亮点是一系列滑稽恐怖的立体模型隔间，代表道教地下世界的各个“部门”。

A temple has stood on this spot for over 700 years since the Mongol-led Yuan dynasty, but these days it’s almost lost in the sprawl. Note the fabulous páifāng (memorial archway) to the south, divided from the main shrine by the busy main road.
自蒙古领导的元朝以来，一座寺庙已经矗立在这片土地上 700 多年，但如今它几乎消失在蔓延中。请注意南边神话般的 páifāng（纪念拱门），被繁忙的主干道与主神殿隔开。

Inside you can muse on life’s finalities by examining the various dust-caked diorama displays, some 72 in total, depicting such scenes as the ‘Department for Wandering Ghosts’ or the ‘Department for Implementing 15 Kinds of Violent Death’. It’s not all doom and gloom: the luckless can check in at the ‘Department for Increasing Good Fortune & Longevity’.
在里面，您可以通过检查各种布满灰尘的立体模型展示来思考生命的最终结局，总共约 72 个，描绘了“游魂部门”或“实施 15 种暴力死亡部门”等场景。这并不全是厄运和阴郁：倒霉的人可以在“增加好运和长寿部门”办理入住手续。

National StadiumARCHITECTURE
国家体育场建筑

(北京国家体育场, Běijīng Guójiā Tǐyùchǎng; Beijing Olympic Green, 奥林匹克公园; normal/VIP ¥40/80; h9am-6pm, VIP night tour 6.30-8.50pm; bLine 8 to Olympic Sports Center, exit B2)
（ 北京国家体育场 ，Běijīng Guójiā Tǐyùchǎng;北京奥林匹克公园， 奥林匹克公园 ;普通/VIP ¥40/80; h 上午 9 点至下午 6 点，VIP 夜游晚上 6：30-8：50; b 8 号线至奥林匹克体育中心 B2 出口）

Known colloquially as the Bird’s Nest (鸟巢, Niǎocháo), the spectacular showpiece of the 2008 Olympics Games was designed by Swiss firm Herzog & de Meuron in consultancy with Beijing artist Ai Weiwei. Most visitors are content to snap photos of the exterior, but sports fans might get a kick out of seeing the track where Usain Bolt broke the 100m world record.
2008 年奥运会的壮观展示品俗称鸟巢（鸟巢 ，Niǎocháo），由瑞士公司 Herzog &; de Meuron 与北京艺术家艾未未顾问共同设计。大多数游客都满足于拍摄外观照片，但体育迷可能会因为看到尤塞恩·博尔特打破 100 米世界纪录的赛道而感到兴奋。

Along with the adjacent Water Cube (国家游泳中心, Guójiā Yóuyǒng Zhōngxīn; www.watercube.com/en; 11 Tianchen Lu, Olympic Park, 天辰东路11号𝄦; ¥30; h9am-7pm, water park 10am-3pm; c) and other venues, the National Stadium was part of a vast Olympic development on Beijing’s central axis that necessitated the eviction of over one million people, according to reports at the time. Appropriately, the area can feel as lifeless as a post-apocalypse zombie flick, although the stadium will be pressed into service once again as the site of the opening and closing ceremonies of the 2022 Winter Olympics, becoming the only stadium to host both the summer and winter games.
与邻近的水立方 （ 国家游泳中心 ，Guójiā Yóuyǒng Zhōngxīn;www.watercube.com/en;11 天辰路，奥林匹克公园， 天辰东路 11 号 𝄦; ¥30; h 上午 9 点至晚上 7 点，水上乐园上午 10 点至下午 3 点; c ） 和其他场馆，国家体育场是北京中轴线上庞大的奥林匹克开发项目的一部分，需要驱逐超过 100 万人，据当时的报道。恰如其分的是，该地区可能会让人感觉像一部后世界末日僵尸电影一样死气沉沉，尽管该体育场将再次作为 2022 年冬奥会开幕式和闭幕式的举办地投入使用，成为唯一同时举办夏季和冬季奥运会的体育场。

Yuan Dynasty Walls Relics ParkPARK
元代城墙遗迹公园 PARK

(元大都城垣遗址公园, Yuán Dàdū Chéngyuán Yízhǐ Gōngyuán; bLines 8, 10 to Beituchang, or Line 10 to Xitucheng) F
（ 元大都城垣遗址公园 ， Yuán Dàdū Chéngyuán Yízhǐ Gōngyuán; b 8、10 号线至北土场，或 10 号线至西土城） F

Back when Beijing was ‘Dadu’, capital of Kublai Khan’s Yuan dynasty, the city was sheltered by an earthwork wall, the northern battlements of which are marked by this 9km-long strip of sculpted parkland. Remarkably, traces of the old earthworks endure. From Beitucheng (literally ‘north earthen wall’) subway station cross to the south side of the moat and head east; in a few moments you’ll spot the original, misshapen mound, overgrown with trees.
当北京还是忽必烈元朝的首都“大都”时，这座城市被土方墙遮挡，其北部城垛以这片 9 公里长的雕刻公园为标志。值得注意的是，旧土方工程的痕迹依然存在。从北土城（字面意思是“北土墙”）地铁站穿过护城河南侧，向东行驶;片刻之后，您就会发现原来的、畸形的土丘，长满了树木。

Ritan ParkPARK
日坛公园 PARK

(日坛公园, Rìtán Gōngyuán; map Google map; 6 Ritan Beilu, 日坛北路6号; h6am-9pm; bLines 1, 2 to Jianguomen, exit B) F
（ 日坛公园 ，Rìtán Gōngyuán; 地图谷歌地图 ;6 Ritan Beilu， 日坛北路 6 号 h 6am-9pm; b 1、2 号线至建国门 B 出口） F

Landscaped like an ornamental Chinese garden, Ritan Park provides peaceful respite for the embassy district’s diplomats and worker bees. The historic highlight is the Altar of the Sun (rìtán), an open-air platform where emperors would perform rites and sacrifices.
日坛公园的景观就像一个观赏性的中国花园，为使馆区的外交官和工蜂提供了宁静的休息场所。历史亮点是太阳祭坛 （rìtán），这是一个露天平台，皇帝将在这里举行仪式和祭祀。

During the Ming dynasty, Beijing had several such altars, the most famous being Tiantan, otherwise known as the Temple of Heaven Park. The Stone Boat (石舫咖啡, Shífǎng Kāfēi; %010 6501 9986; beers & coffee from ¥20, cocktails from ¥40; h10am-6pm; W), beside an ornamental pond overhung by willows, is a lovely spot for a drink.
明朝时期，北京有好几个这样的祭坛，最著名的是天坛， 又称天坛公园 。石舫咖啡 （ 石舫咖啡 ，Shífǎng Kāfēi; % 010 6501 9986;啤酒和咖啡 20 日元起，鸡尾酒 40 日元起; h 上午 10 点至下午 6 点; W ） 旁边是一个被柳树覆盖的观赏池塘，是一个喝酒的好地方。

CCTV HeadquartersARCHITECTURE
央视总部建筑

(央视大楼, Yāngshì Dàlóu; map Google map; 32 Dongsanhuan Zhonglu, 东三环中路32号; bLine 10 to Jintaixizhao, exit C)
（ 央视大楼 ， Yāngshì Dàlóu; 地图谷歌地图 ;东三环中路 32 号 东三环中路 32 号 b 10 号线至金太西照 C 出口）

Known locally as dà kùchǎ (大裤衩, Big Pants), the 234m-tall CCTV Tower is an architectural fantasy that appears to defy gravity. Designed by Rem Koolhaas and Ole Scheeren, the building has become an icon of the Beijing skyline since being completed in 2008 in time for the Olympics.
234 米高的中央电视塔在当地被称为“ 大裤衩 ”， 是一个看似对抗地心引力的建筑幻想。该建筑由雷姆·库哈斯（Rem Koolhaas）和奥莱·谢伦（Ole Scheeren）设计，自 2008 年奥运会前竣工以来，已成为北京天际线的标志。

1Summer Palace & Haidian
1 颐和园 & 海淀

oSummer PalaceHISTORIC SITE
o 颐和园历史遗址

(颐和园, Yíhé Yuán; map Google map; 19 Xinjian Gongmen, 新建宫门19号; Apr-Oct ¥30, through ticket ¥60, Nov-Mar ¥20, through ticket ¥50, audio guide ¥40; h6.30am-6pm, sights 8.30am-5pm Apr-Oct, 7am-5pm, sights 9am-4pm Nov-Mar; bLine 4 to Beigongmen or Xiyaun, dXijiao Line to West Gate of Summer Palace)
（ 颐和园 ，Yíhé Yuán; 地图谷歌地图 ;19 新建宫门，新建宫门 19 号 ;4-10 月 30 日元，直通票 60 日元，11 月-3 月 20 日元，直通票 50 日元，语音导览 40 日元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 6.30 至下午 6.30，景点上午 8.30 至下午 5 点，11 月至 3 月上午 7 点至下午 5 点，景点上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 4 号线至北宫门或西云， d 西郊线至颐和园西门）

A marvel of Chinese garden design and one of Beijing’s must-see attractions, the Summer Palace was the royal retreat for emperors fleeing the suffocating summer torpor of the old imperial city and, most recently, it was the retirement playground of Empress Dowager Cixi. It merits an entire day’s exploration, although a (high-paced) morning or afternoon exploring its waterways, pavilions, bridges and temples may suffice.
颐和园是中国园林设计的奇迹，也是北京必看的景点之一，是皇帝们逃离古皇城令人窒息的夏日昏迷的皇家度假胜地，最近，它是慈禧太后的退休游乐场。它值得一整天的探索，尽管（快节奏的）上午或下午探索它的水道、亭台楼阁、桥梁和寺庙可能就足够了。

The domain had long been a royal garden before being considerably enlarged and embellished by Emperor Qianlong in the 18th century. He marshalled an army of labourers to deepen and expand Kunming Lake (昆明湖; Kunming Hú), originally a reservoir dug in the Yuan dynasty, and reputedly surveyed imperial navy drills from a hilltop perch.
该领地长期以来一直是皇家花园，直到 18 世纪乾隆皇帝对其进行了大幅扩建和装饰。他召集了一支劳动力大军，加深和扩大昆明湖 （ 昆明湖 ;昆明湖），最初是元代挖掘的水库，据说在山顶栖息处勘察了帝国海军的演习。

Anglo-French troops vandalised the palace at the end of the Second Opium War in 1860. Empress Dowager Cixi launched into a refit in 1888 with money earmarked for a modern navy; the marble boat map Google map (清晏舫, Qīngyuàn Chuán) at the northern edge of the lake was her only nautical, albeit quite unsinkable, concession. Foreign troops, angered by the Boxer Rebellion, had another go at torching the Summer Palace in 1900, prompting further restoration work. By 1949 the palace had once more fallen into disrepair, eliciting a major overhaul.
1860 年第二次鸦片战争结束时，英法军队破坏了这座宫殿。慈禧太后于 1888 年开始改装，资金专门用于现代海军;湖北边的大理石船图谷歌地图 （ 清晏舫 ，Qīngyuàn Chuán） 是她唯一的航海特许权，尽管是永不沉没的。1900 年，外国军队因义和团运动而愤怒，再次尝试焚烧颐和园，促使进一步的修复工作。到 1949 年，这座宫殿再次年久失修，引发了一次大修。

Glittering Kunming Lake swallows up three-quarters of the park, overlooked by Longevity Hill (万寿山, Wànshòu Shān), itself crowned by the eight-tiered Tower of Buddhist Incense map Google map (佛香阁, Fóxiāng Gé), the most elaborate and expensive restoration project of Cixi’s grand redesign. Arranged on a north–south axis, the tower rises up behind the Hall of Dispelling Clouds map Google map (排云殿, Páiyún Diàn), built by Emperor Qianlong for his mother on her 60th birthday. At the foot of Longevity Hill, hugging the north shore of the lake, is the Long Corridor map Google map (长廊, Cháng Láng), a canopied, 728m-long ornamental walkway. Thousands of artworks adorn every crossbeam, column and ceiling arch, depicting scenic views from around China, much-loved myths, Buddhist scenes and folk tales.
波光粼粼的昆明湖吞没了公园的四分之三，俯瞰着万寿山， 万寿山本身就以八层佛香阁地图谷歌地图 （ 佛香阁 ，Fóxiāng Gé） 为顶端，这是慈禧宏伟重新设计中最精致、最昂贵的修复工程。塔呈南北轴线排列，耸立在驱云殿地图谷歌地图 （ 排云殿 ，Páiyún Diàn） 后面，是乾隆皇帝在母亲 60 岁生日时为她建造的。在长寿山脚下，紧邻湖北岸，是长廊地图谷歌地图 （ 长廊 ，Cháng Láng）， 一条长 728 米的天篷观赏步道。数以千计的艺术品装饰着每一个横梁、柱子和天花板拱门，描绘了中国各地的风景、备受喜爱的神话、佛教场景和民间故事。

At the western end of the Long Corridor is Cixi’s Marble Boat (清晏舫, Qīngyuàn Chuán), a place to entertain (and a common garden design motif), while at the eastern end are her living quarters, the Hall of Joy and Longevity map Google map (乐寿堂, Lèshòu Táng), which echoes the sìhéyuàn layout of traditional Beijing courtyards, and still contains dusty Qing-era furniture. Continue east to the threestorey Grand Theatre map Google map (大戏楼, Dàxìlóu; ¥10) where Cixi would enjoy her beloved Peking opera. Nearby, the Hall of Benevolence and Longevity map Google map (仁寿殿, Rénshòu Diàn) was where the empress dowager still pulled the government strings late into her official retirement. Glimpse the grand throne within; the rockery outside was designed to mimic the famous Lion Grove Garden in Suzhou. Note also the dragon and phoenix statues in the courtyard, the symbolic embodiment of emperor and empress. Here it’s the phoenix that commands centre spot, a clear sign that a woman – Cixi – was running the show.
长廊的西端是慈禧的大理石船 （ 清晏舫 ，Qīngyuàn Chuán）， 一个娱乐场所（也是常见的园林设计主题），而东端是她的居住区，乐寿堂地图（乐寿堂 ，Lèshòu Táng）， 与西河元相呼应传统北京庭院的布局，仍包含尘土飞扬的清代家具。继续向东行驶，到达三层楼的大剧院地图 （ 大戏楼 ，Dàxìlóu;10 日元）， 慈禧将在那里欣赏她心爱的京剧。附近，仁寿殿地图谷歌地图 （ 仁寿殿 ，Rénshòu Diàn） 是太后在正式退休后仍然牵着政府牵线的地方。瞥见里面的宏伟宝座;外面的假山模仿了苏州著名的狮林花园。还要注意庭院里的龙凤雕像，这是皇帝和皇后的象征性体现。在这里，凤凰占据了中心位置，这是一个明显的迹象，表明一个女人——慈禧——正在主持这场表演。

If time permits, try to do a circuit of the lake along the West Causeway map Google map (西堤, Xīdī). You can exit the palace via the West Gate, where you can pick up the Xiijiao Line back to the city, or return along the east shore. Based on the famous Su Causeway in Hangzhou, and lined with willow and mulberry trees, the causeway kicks off northwest of the Marble Boat (清晏舫, Qīngyuàn Chuán). With its delightful moon hump, the Jade Belt Bridge map Google map (玉带桥, Yùdài Qiáo) dates from the reign of Emperor Qianlong and crosses the point where the Jade River enters the lake (when it flows).
如果时间允许，可以尝试沿着西堤地图谷歌地图 （ 西堤 ，西地） 绕湖一圈。可从西门出宫，乘坐西教线回城，或沿东岸返回。堤道以杭州著名的苏堤为蓝本，柳树和桑树成荫，从清晏舫（清晏舫 ，Qīngyuàn Chuán） 的西北方向开始。玉带桥地图（ 玉带桥 ，Yùdài Qiáo） 以其令人愉悦的月亮驼峰，其历史可以追溯到乾隆皇帝统治时期，穿过玉河入湖点（当玉河流过时）。

At the base of the rear of Longevity Hill is Suzhou Street map Google map (苏州街, Sūzhōu Jiē), built to mimic the waterways and architecture of the famous Jiangsu canal town. Here is where emperors and their concubines would pretend to be common folk by ‘shopping’ for trinkets in the ersatz stores that lined the shore, with eunuchs acting as shopkeepers. Today it’s full of actual souvenir shops, which, ironically, makes it rather authentic.
长寿山后方的脚下是苏州街地图 （ 苏州街 ，Sūzhōu Jiē）， 模仿江苏运河小镇的水道和建筑而建。在这里，皇帝和他们的妃嫔会假装是普通人，在岸边的旧商店里“购买”小饰品，太监充当店主。今天，这里到处都是真正的纪念品商店，具有讽刺意味的是，这使得它相当真实。

Old Summer PalaceHISTORIC SITE
圆明园历史遗址

(圆明园, Yuánmíng Yuán; %010 6261 6375; 28 Qinghua Xilu, 清华西路28号; adult ¥10, through ticket ¥25, map ¥6; h7am-6pm Apr, Sep & Oct, to 5.30pm Nov-Mar, to 7pm May-Aug; bLine 4 to Yuanmingyuan, exit A)
（ 圆明园 ，Yuánmíng Yuán; % 010 6261 6375; 清华西路清华西路 28 号 ; 成人 10 日元，直通票 25 日元，地图 6 日元; h 4 月、9 月和 10 月上午 7 点至下午 6 点，11 月至 3 月至下午 5 点 30 分，5 月至 8 月至晚上 7 点; b 4 号线至圆明园，A 出口）

Shattered ruins are all that remain of the ‘Garden of Perfection and Light’, once known as the ‘Versailles of the East’ for its profound beauty, even surpassing Cixi’s 19th century reboot. Jesuit-designed palaces and hundreds of Chinese, Tibetan and Mongolian-style buildings ranged across 350 hectares of exquisitely landscaped gardens – all put to the torch by the British in 1860 (after a thorough looting by the French) at the close of the Second Opium War. What’s left is now a public park.
破碎的废墟是“完美与光明花园”的全部遗迹，它曾因其深邃的美丽而被称为“东方凡尔赛宫”，甚至超过了慈禧 19 世纪的重启。 耶稣会设计的宫殿和数百座中国、西藏和蒙古风格的建筑分布在占地 350 公顷的精美园林中——所有这些都在 1860 年第二次鸦片战争结束时被英国人（在法国人彻底抢劫后）付之一炬。现在剩下的是一个公园。

The looting and destruction of the Old Summer Palace is an event forever inscribed in Chinese history books as a low point in China’s humiliation by foreign powers. Lord Elgin, British High Commissioner to China in 1860, ordered the destruction in response to the torture and killing of British envoys attempting to negotiate with the Qing forces under a flag of truce. Some 3500 troops systematically set the palace ablaze, the fire lasting three days.
圆明园被抢劫和破坏是中国历史书中永远铭刻的事件，是中国被列强羞辱的低谷。1860 年，英国驻华高级专员埃尔金勋爵下令销毁，以回应试图在停战旗帜下与清军谈判的英国使节遭到酷刑和杀害。大约 3500 名士兵有计划地纵火焚烧了宫殿，大火持续了三天。

The subdued marble ruins of the Palace Buildings Scenic Area (Xīyánglóu Jǐngqū) can be mulled over in the Eternal Spring Garden (Chángchūn Yuán) in the northeast of the park, near the east gate. There were once more than 10 buildings here, designed by Jesuits Giuseppe Castiglione and Michael Benoist. The buildings were only partially destroyed during the 1860 Anglo-French looting and the structures apparently remained usable for quite some time afterwards. However, the ruins were gradually picked over and carted away by local people all the way up to the 1970s.
宫廷建筑景区 （Xīyánglóu Jǐngqū）的低沉大理石遗址可以在公园东北部靠近东门的永春园 （Chángchūn Yuán）中欣赏。这里曾经有 10 多座建筑，由耶稣会士朱塞佩·卡斯蒂廖内 （Giuseppe Castiglione） 和迈克尔·贝诺伊斯特 （Michael Benoist） 设计。这些建筑物在 1860 年英法抢劫中仅被部分摧毁，这些建筑显然在之后的相当长一段时间内仍然可用。然而，直到 1970 年代，这些废墟逐渐被当地人捡起并运走。

The Great Fountain Ruins (Dàshuǐfǎ) are considered the best-preserved relics. Built in 1759, the main building was fronted by a lion-head fountain. Standing opposite is the Guanshuifa, five large stone screens embellished with European carvings of military flags, armour, swords and guns. The screens were discovered in the grounds of Peking University in the 1970s and later restored to their original positions. Just east of the Great Fountain Ruins stood a four-pillar archway, chunks of which remain.
大喷泉遗址 （Dàshuǐfǎ）被认为是保存最完好的遗迹。主楼建于 1759 年，前面有一个狮头喷泉。对面矗立的是观水发 ，五座大石屏风，上面装饰着欧洲的军旗、盔甲、剑和枪支雕刻。这些屏风于 1970 年代在北京大学校园内被发现，后来恢复到原来的位置。大喷泉遗址的东边矗立着一座四柱拱门，其中大部分仍然存在。

OFF THE BEATEN TRACK
人迹罕至的地方

Way out on the northeastern fringes of Beijing, the hangar-like China Railway Museum (中国铁道博物馆, Zhōngguó Tiědào Bówùguǎn; %010 6438 1317; north of 1 Jiuxianqiao Bei Lu, Chaoyang District, 朝阳区酒仙桥北路1号院北侧; ¥20; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun) contains dozens of historic locos, including several souped-up carriages used by Mao and other senior cadres during the 1960s and ’70s – trainspotters will be ecstatic. There are English captions. A taxi from the centre of town will cost around ¥60.
中国铁道博物馆（中国铁道博物馆 ，Zhōngguó Tiědào Bówùguǎn; % 010 6438 1317;朝阳区酒仙桥北路 1 号院北侧，朝阳区酒仙桥北路 1 号院北侧 ; ¥20; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点） 包含数十个历史悠久的机车，包括 1960 年代和 70 年代毛和其他高级干部使用的几节增强型车厢——火车观察员会欣喜若狂。有英文字幕。从市中心乘坐出租车的费用约为 60 日元。

oWuta TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
o 乌塔寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(五塔寺, Wǔtǎ Sì; %010 6218 9514; 24 Wutasi Cun, 五塔寺村24号; adult ¥20; h9am-4pm Tue-Sun; bLine 4 to National Library, exit C)
（ 五塔寺 ，Wǔtǎ Sì; % 010 6218 9514; 五塔寺村五塔寺村 24 号 24 号 ; 成人 20 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4 点; b 4 号线到国家图书馆，C 出口）

If any Beijing sight can vanquish the dreaded ‘temple fatigue’, it’s Wǔtǎ Sì. This little-known gem is eminently worthy of a pilgrimage, not just for its remarkable design, which owes more to India than imperial China, but also for the magnificent scatter of ancient stonemasonry – statues, stelae, altars and thrones – salvaged from sights around Beijing and plonked here for posterity.
如果说北京有什么景点可以克服可怕的“寺庙疲劳”，那就是武陶寺。这颗鲜为人知的宝石非常值得朝圣，不仅因为它非凡的设计，它更多地归功于印度，而不是中国帝国，还因为从北京各地的景点中打捞出来的古代石工——雕像、石碑、祭坛和宝座——散落在这里留给后代。

Built in 1473 for a visiting Indian lama, Zhenjue Temple (as it was actually called) was one of many temples lining the imperial waterway linking the capital with the northwest palaces. This one was a particular favourite of the Qing emperors – Qianlong threw two lavish birthday parties here for his mum, and had a similar pagoda built at the Azure Clouds Temple. But by the end of the dynasty, neglect, fire and general upheaval had seen off its six wooden halls, and so it became known for its remaining standout feature, the all-stone Wǔtǎ (Five Pagodas).
真觉寺（实际上被称为真觉寺）建于 1473 年，是连接首都和西北宫殿的皇家水道两旁的众多寺庙之一。这是清朝皇帝特别喜欢的——乾隆在这里为他的母亲举办了两次奢华的生日派对，并在青云寺建造了一座类似的宝塔。但到了王朝末期，疏忽、火灾和普遍的动荡已经摧毁了它的六座木制大厅，因此它以其仅存的突出特色——全石五塔而闻名。

Inspired by the Mahabodhi Temple in India, the boxlike Wǔtǎ (or Diamond Throne Pagoda) is pockmarked on all four sides by hundreds of images of Buddha, each with unique mudras (hand gestures), above a band of elephants, deities and Buddhist symbols, with Sanskrit trimming the base. Among its crown of five stupas, the yellow glazed-tile roof was a later Qing dynasty embellishment, effectively a seal of approval for royal use.
受印度摩诃菩提寺的启发，盒子状的 Wǔtǎ（或钻石宝座塔）的四个面都有数百尊佛像，每尊佛像都有独特的手印（手势），上方是一带大象、神灵和佛教符号，底部饰有梵文。在其五座佛塔的皇冠中，黄釉瓦屋顶是清代后期的装饰，实际上是皇家使用的认可印章。

In lieu of its long-lost temple halls, foundations of which can still be seen, the relatively empty grounds have been given over to the Beijing Art Museum of Stone Carvings, and are full of inspiring slabs of sculpture and stonework, many dating back to the Mongol Yuan dynasty and some as far back as the Eastern Han.
相对空旷的场地已被北京石雕美术馆取代了失传已久的寺庙大厅，其地基仍然清晰可见，并摆满了鼓舞人心的雕塑和石雕板，其中许多可以追溯到蒙古元朝，有些可以追溯到东汉。

For more temple action, stroll west along the riverbank and you’ll come to Wanshou Temple in 20 to 30 minutes.
如果想参观更多寺庙活动，可以沿着河岸向西漫步，20 到 30 分钟即可到达万寿寺。

STATE OF THE ART
最先进的技术

Some say 798 Art District lost its soul years ago. For more gutsy Chinese art, take a taxi to nearby Coachangdi (草场地; Cǎochǎngdì), but hurry – what few galleries survived the 2018 demolitions are in perpetual peril.
有人说 798 艺术区几年前就失去了灵魂。如果想欣赏更多大胆的中国艺术，可以乘坐出租车前往附近的科昌地 （ 草场地 ;Cǎochǎngdì），但要快点——在 2018 年的拆除中幸存下来的少数画廊永远处于危险之中。

Wanshou TempleBUDDHIST TEMPLE
万寿寺 BUDDHIST TEMPLE

(万寿寺, Wànshòu Sì; 121 Wanshousi Lu, 万寿寺路121号; adult ¥20; h9am-4.30pm Tue-Sun; bLines 4, 9 to National Library, exit A)
万寿寺路 121 号 ，成人 20 日元; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4.30; b 4、9 号线至国家图书馆 A 出口）

This tranquil, littlevisited temple was originally consecrated for the storage of Buddhist texts. Its name echoes the Summer Palace’s Longevity Hill (Wanshou means ‘longevity’) and the imperial entourage would stop here to quaff tea en route to and from the palace. It was undergoing extensive renovation at time of research.
这座宁静、鲜为人知的寺庙最初是为存放佛教经典而奉献的。它的名字与颐和园的长寿山（万寿的意思是“长寿”）相呼应，皇室随行人员在往返皇宫的途中会在这里停下来喝茶。在研究时，它正在进行大规模的翻修。

Great Bell TempleBUDDHIST SITE
大钟寺佛教遗址

(大钟寺, Dàzhōng Sì; %010 8213 9050; 31a Beisanhuan Xilu, 北三环西路31a号; ¥30; h9am-4.30pm Tue-Sun; bLine 13 to Dazhongsi, exit A)
（ 大钟寺 ，Dàzhōng Sì; % 010 8213 9050; 北三环西路北三环西路 31a 号 ; ¥30; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4.30; b 13 号线到大中寺，A 出口）

Despite being stranded along the North 3rd Ring Rd, this Qing-era temple is well worth a diversion to marvel at its centrepiece, the humongous Yongle Bell, cast in 1406 and almost 7m tall. The temple halls have been entirely given over to the fascinating and well-presented Dazhongsi Ancient Bell Museum, where you can admire up close the intricate inscriptions and artistry adorning hundreds of temple bells.
尽管这座清代寺庙被困在北三环路沿线，但它的中心建筑——巨大的永乐钟，建于 1406 年，高近 7 米，非常值得一看。寺庙大厅已完全被迷人且精心布置的大中寺古钟博物馆所取代，在那里您可以近距离欣赏数百座寺钟上错综复杂的铭文和艺术。

Military Museum of the People’s RevolutionMUSEUM
人民革命军事博物馆 MUSEUM

(军事博物馆, Junshi Bówùguǎn; http://eng.jb.mil.cn; 9 Fuxing Lu, 复兴路9号; h9am-5pm Tue-Sun; bLines 1, 9 to Military Museum, exit A) F
（ 军事博物馆 ，Junshi Bówùguǎn;http://eng.jb.mil.cn;9 复兴路， 复兴路 9 号 h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 5 点; b 1、9 号线至军事博物馆 A 出口） F

Bristling with Cold War–era planes, guns and bombs, this cavernous museum shows China at its most hawkish. Expanded in 2018, many of the side exhibits were yet to open at time of research, but if they were anything like the former Hall of Agrarian Revolutionary War and the Hall of the War to Resist US Aggression and Aid Korea, then they will remain a tour de force of communist spin.
这座巨大的博物馆摆满了冷战时期的飞机、枪支和炸弹，展示了中国最鹰派的一面。2018 年扩建的许多副展览在研究时尚未开放，但如果它们像前土地革命战争馆和抗美援朝战争馆，那么它们仍将是共产主义旋转的杰作。

OFF THE BEATEN TRACK
人迹罕至的地方

STUDENT LIFE
学生生活

A stroll through the historic campus of prestigious Peking University (北京大学, Běijīng Dàxué; http://english.pku.edu.cn; 5 Yiheyuan Lu, 颐和园路5号; bLine 4 to East Gate of Peking University, exit A) offers a window on to the student lives of China’s brightest young minds. Be sure to stop in at the Arthur M Sackler Museum of Art & Archaeology (赛克勒考古与艺术博物馆, Sàikèlè Kǎogǔ Yǔ Yìshù Bówùguǎn; h9am-4.30pm Tue-Sun) F near the west gate.
漫步在著名的北京大学 （Běijīng Dàxué;http://english.pku.edu.cn;5 颐和园路 5 号 b 4 号线至北京大学东门，A）出口 ，为中国最聪明的年轻人的学生生活提供了一扇窗口。一定要去 Arthur M Sackler Museum of Art &; Archaeology（ 赛克勒考古与艺术博物馆 ，Sàikèlè Kǎogǔ Yǔ Yìshù Bówùguǎn; h 周二至周日上午 9 点至下午 4.30） F 位于西门附近。

TTours & Activities
T 旅游与活动

Guided walks and tours are a great way to see beyond the state-sanctioned narrative to the deeper, more human stories, both complex and compelling, that make Beijing such a fascinating city. A little knowledge goes a long way!
带导游的步行和旅游是一种很好的方式，可以超越国家认可的叙述，了解更深刻、更人性化的故事，这些故事既复杂又引人入胜，使北京成为一座如此迷人的城市。一点知识大有帮助！

oBeijing PostcardsHISTORY
o 北京明信片历史

(map Google map; %156 1145 3992; www.bjpostcards.com; 97 Yangmeizhu Xiejie, Dashilar, 杨梅竹斜街97号; walks per person from ¥300; hnoon-6pm Wed-Sun; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit C)
（ 地图谷歌地图 ; % 156 1145 3992;www.bjpostcards.com;97 杨梅竹斜街大石勒杨美竹斜街 97 号 ; 步行每人 300 日元起; h 周三至周日中午至下午 6 点; b 2 号线到前门，C 出口）

The capital’s best purveyor of history tours in English, Beijing Postcards hosts a range of rigorously researched walks and talks led by Danish co-founder Lars. The weekly ‘Crash Course to the Forbidden City’ walk is a fine way to navigate the capital’s confounding imperial waters. Check the website for schedules and booking.
北京明信片是首都最好的英语历史之旅提供商，举办一系列经过严格研究的步行和讲座，由丹麦联合创始人拉尔斯主持。每周一次的“紫禁城速成班”步行是在首都令人困惑的帝国水域中航行的好方法。查看网站了解时间表和预订。

Beijing by FootTOURS
北京徒步旅游

(www.beijingbyfoot.com; tours from ¥300)
（www.beijingbyfoot.com 团 300 日元起）

Perpetually in search of old Peking, American guide and teacher of modern Chinese history Jeremiah Jenne spins gripping yarns at Beijing’s major sites. Get acquainted with Empress Cixi at the Summer Palace, meet Mao and the making of modern China at Tian’anmen and much more besides. Regularly scheduled tours can be booked on the website, or via The Hutong. Private and custom tours available on request.
为了永远寻找老北京，美国导游和中国现代史教师耶利米·詹恩（Jeremiah Jenne）在北京的主要景点纺纱线。在颐和园结识慈禧皇后，在天安门会见毛和现代中国的形成等等。定期安排的旅游可以在网站上预订，也可以通过胡同预订 。可应要求提供私人和定制旅游。

UnTour Food ToursFOOD
UnTour 美食之旅 FOOD

(https://untourfoodtours.com; per person US$70; h7pm Mon, Tue, Fri & Sat)
（https://untourfoodtours.com 人 70 美元; h 周一、周二、周五和周六晚上 7 点）

A belt-busting adventure for foodies, UnTour’s ‘Old Beijing Dinner Tour’ is three hours of unbridled eating and drinking at locales scattered throughout the hutong of Dongcheng district. Each meal (and there are many, so pace yourself) comes with an informed introduction and all the beer and báijiǔ (clear liquor) you can drink.
UnTour 的“老北京晚餐之旅”是美食家的狂欢冒险之旅，在东城区衚衕各处的三个小时肆无忌惮的饮食中进行。每顿饭（而且有很多，所以要调整自己的节奏）都附有知情的介绍以及您可以喝的所有啤酒和白酒。

Newman ToursTOURS
纽曼旅游 TOURS

(https://newmantours.com; per person from ¥290, based on group of 4; c)
（https://newmantours.com 人 290 日元起，以 4 人成团为准; c

Garnishing guided walks with iPads, props and fancy dress, Newman Tours are ideal for families and those who like their Beijing history served up with a side order of laughs and surprises. Popular tours include the ‘History of China in 50 Objects’ jaunt around the National Museum of China and an evening ghost tour at Houhai Lake.
纽曼之旅用 iPad、道具和化装装饰带导游的步行，非常适合家庭和那些喜欢北京历史的人，并提供欢笑和惊喜。受欢迎的旅游项目包括中国国家博物馆的“50 件物品中的中国历史”之旅和后海湖的晚间幽灵之旅。

Newman Tours need to be booked privately in advance via email.
纽曼之旅需要提前通过电子邮件私人预订。

B Electric Bike ToursTOURS
B 电动自行车之旅 TOURS

(map Google map; http://belectricbeijing.com; 10 Shiqie Hutong, 石雀胡同10号; per person ¥300; bLine 5 to Beixinqiao, exit C)
（ 地图谷歌地图 ;http://belectricbeijing.com;10 石雀胡同， 石雀胡同 10 号 ;每人¥300; b 5 号线至北新桥 C 出口）

Zip effortlessly around the Dongcheng sights on this three-hour e-scooter tour – ideal for sticky summer days when walking or cycling feels like too much effort. You’ll pass the Drum & Bell towers, Houhai Lake and the Forbidden City, keeping mostly to hutong alleyways along the way. Twice-weekly group tours start and end at the Culture Yard; see website. Private tours can be arranged on request.
在这个三小时的电动滑板车之旅中，您可以毫不费力地游览东城景点 - 非常适合在潮湿的夏日步行或骑自行车感觉太费力时。您将经过鼓钟楼、后海湖和紫禁城，沿途大部分时间都是衚衕巷。每周两次的团体旅游在文化场开始和结束;见网站。酒店可应要求安排私人旅游。

The HutongCOOKING
胡同烹饪

(map Google map; %159 0104 6127; www.thehutong.com; 1 Jiudaowan Zhongxiang, 九道弯中巷1号; per member/nonmember ¥260/300; h9.30am-10pm; bLine 5 to Beixinqiao, exit C)
（ 地图 ：谷歌地图 ; % 159 0104 6127;www.thehutong.com;1 九道弯中巷 1 号 ;每名会员/非会员 260/300 日元; h 上午 9.30 至晚上 10 点; b 5 号线至北新桥 C 出口）

A smorgasbord of cooking classes covers everything from Chinese knife skills to xiaolongbao soup dumplings at this long-established cultural centre in a hutong courtyard. Tea lovers can embark on a highly caffeinated tour of the Maliandao Tea Market, discovering China’s most famous teas and tea regions.
在这个位于衚衕庭院的历史悠久的文化中心，从中国刀技到小笼包汤包，各种烹饪课程涵盖各种内容。茶爱好者可以踏上富含咖啡因的马连岛茶叶市场之旅，探索中国最著名的茶叶和茶产区。

Culture YardLANGUAGE
文化庭院语言

(天井越洋, Tiānjǐng Yuèyáng; map Google map; %010 8404 4166; www.cultureyard.net; 10 Shique Hutong, 石雀胡同10号; h9am-9pm Mon-Thu, 10am-4pm Fri & Sat; bLine 5 to Beixinqiao, exit C)
（ 天井越洋 ，Tiānjǐng Yuèyáng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 8404 4166;www.cultureyard.net;10 石雀胡同 10 号 h 周一至周四上午 9 时至晚上 9 时，周五及周六上午 10 时至下午 4 时; b 5 号线至北新桥 C 出口）

A little language goes a long way in China, so consider investing in a ‘Survival Chinese’ course at this hutong school as the prelude to your wider Middle Kingdom sojourns. Five days of lessons (¥1800, 20 hours), shared between classroom time and field trips to local markets and restaurants, will furnish you with a basic toolbox for bargaining, meeting and greeting, and getting around.
在中国，一点语言大有帮助，所以可以考虑在这所胡同学校投资一门“生存汉语”课程，作为您在更广泛的中国之旅的前奏。为期五天的课程（1800 日元，20 小时）在课堂时间和当地市场和餐馆的实地考察之间共享，将为您提供讨价还价、见面和问候以及出行的基本工具箱。

WORTH A TRIP
值得一游

FRAGRANT HILLS PARK
香山公园

A great swath of Beijing’s Western Hills (Xīshān) was once an imperial pleasure resort, its acres of undulating pine-cypress forest peppered with temples, pavilions and lookouts dating from the Qing dynasty. Opened to the masses as a public park in 1956, Fragrant Hills (香山公园, Xiāng Shān Gōngyuán; 40 Maimai Jie, 买卖街40号; Apr-Oct ¥10, Nov-Mar ¥5; h6am-6.30pm Apr-Oct, to 6pm Nov-Mar; dXijiao Line to Fragrant Hills) is busiest in autumn when the maples are ablaze. On reasonably clear days you can see Beijing’s skyscrapers, 20km distant, from Incense-Burner Peak.
北京西山（西山）的大片土地曾经是皇家度假胜地，数英亩起伏的松柏林中点缀着清朝时期的寺庙、亭台楼阁和瞭望台。香山公园（香山公园 ，Xiāng Shān Gōngyuán;40 Maimai Jie， 买卖街 40 号 ;4 月-10 月 10 日元，11 月-3 月 5 日元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 6 点至下午 6.30,11 月至 3 月下午 6 点; d 西郊线至香山） 在枫树燃烧的秋天最繁忙。在相当晴朗的日子里，您可以看到北京的摩天大楼，距离香炉峰 20 公里。

To most visitors, Fragrant Hills Park is a thigh-burning ascent up zigzag lanes and endless steps, passing imperial villas and temples, many of which, incredibly, served as summer homes to Beijing’s foreign diplomatic community in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Allow an hour from the main north entrance to Incense-Burner Peak (Xiānglú Fēng, 557m). From the top you get all-embracing views of the countryside, and you can leave the crowds behind by hiking further into the Western Hills.
对于大多数游客来说，香山公园是一条烧大腿的山坡，沿着曲折的小巷和无尽的台阶，经过皇家别墅和寺庙，令人难以置信的是，其中许多在 19 世纪末和 20 世纪初是北京外国外交界的避暑别墅。从香炉峰 （香炉峰，557 米）的正北入口出发，需要一个小时。从山顶您可以欣赏到乡村的壮丽景色，您还可以远足到西部山区，将人群抛在身后。

Rather than making straight for the summit, you could start with a visit to the Azure Clouds Temple (碧云寺, Bìyún Sì; 40 Maimai Jie, Fragrant Hills Park, 买卖街40号香山公园; adult ¥10; h9am-4.30pm; dXijiao Line to Fragrant Hills), just inside the park’s main north entrance, with its five-towered pagoda and hall of 500 Buddhist luóhàn statues. Southwest of the temple is the enormous, Tibetan-style Temple of Brilliance (Zhāo Miào), under restoration at time of research, while nearby is Xiangshan’s iconic Glazed Tile Pagoda. Both survived visits by foreign troops intent on sacking the area in 1860, and then in 1900.
与其直接前往山顶，不如先参观碧云寺 （ 碧云寺 ，Bìyún Sì;40 Maimai Jie， Fragrant Hills Park， 买卖街 40 号香山公园 ;成人 10 日元; h 上午 9 点至下午 4.30; d 西郊线至香山）位于公园的北入口内，拥有五塔塔和 500 尊佛像的大厅。寺庙的西南部是巨大的藏式光辉寺 （赵庙），在研究时正在修复中，而附近是象山标志性的琉璃瓦塔 。两者在 1860 年和 1900 年意图洗劫该地区的外国军队的访问中幸存下来。

Then you could take the chairlift (¥80 one way, 9am to 4pm) to the peak, saving your energy for a long amble downhill, past various of the park’s ‘28 scenic spots’ as selected by Emperor Qianlong in the 18th century, several of which were undergoing restoration at time of research.
然后您可以乘坐缆车 （单程 80 日元，上午 9 点至下午 4 点）到达山顶，节省体力，长时间下坡，经过 18 世纪乾隆皇帝选择的公园“28 个景点”，其中几个景点在研究时正在修复中。

There are restaurants, shops and snacks along Meichang Jie, the old paved approach to the north gate of the park.
梅场街沿线有餐馆、商店和小吃，梅昌街是通往公园北门的古老铺砌通道。

One stop away on the Xijiao Line is the Botanical Gardens (北京植物园, Běijīng Zhíwùyuán; www.beijingbg.com; Xiangshan Nanlu, 香山南路; ¥5, through ticket ¥50; h6am-8pm Apr-Oct, 7.30am-5pm Nov-Mar; dXijiao Line to Botanical Garden), where Puyi, China’s last emperor, tended the gardens between 1960 and 1961 after 10 years of political reeducation under the communists.
乘坐西郊线一站即可到达植物园 （ 北京植物园 ，Běijīng Zhíwùyuán;www.beijingbg.com; 香山南路， 香山南路 ;5 元，直通票 50 元; h 4 月至 10 月上午 6 点至晚上 8 点，11 月至 3 月上午 7.30 点至下午 5 点; d 西郊线至植物园 ），中国最后一位皇帝溥仪在共产党统治下进行了 10 年的政治再教育后，于 1960 年至 1961 年间照料了这些花园。

Black Sesame KitchenCOOKING
黑芝麻厨房烹饪

(黑芝麻厨房, Hēi Zhīma Chúfáng; map Google map; %136 9147 4408; www.blacksesamekitchen.com; 28 Zhonglao Hutong, 中老胡同28号; hcooking classes 11am Wed & Sun, dinner 7pm most nights; bLines 6, 8 to Nanluoguxiang, exit A)
（ 黑芝麻厨房 ， Hēi Zhīma Chúfáng; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 136 9147 4408;www.blacksesamekitchen.com;28 中老胡同， 中老胡同 28 号 h 烹饪班，周三、周日上午 11 点，晚餐，晚上 7 点; b 6、8 号线至南螺鼓巷 A 出口）

Learn the ways of the wok, and get your dumplingwrapping skills in order, at this longestablished cooking school better known these days for its 10-course communal dinners (¥350 including wine and beer). The cooking classes (same price, no booze) take place on Wednesdays and Sundays at 11am – booking ahead is required.
在这所历史悠久的烹饪学校学习炒锅的方法，并掌握包饺子的技巧，如今以其 10 道菜的公共晚餐（包括葡萄酒和啤酒 350 日元）而闻名。烹饪课程（价格相同，不含酒）在周三和周日上午 11 点举行 - 需要提前预订。

Bespoke Travel CoTOURS
定制旅游公司旅游

(map Google map; %151 0167 9082; https://bespoketravelcompany.com; 7th fl, 10 Jintong Xilu, 金桐西路10号远洋光华国际AB座7层; bLine 10 to Jintaixizhao, exit B)
（ 地图谷歌地图 ; % 151 0167 9082;https://bespoketravelcompany.com;金桐西路 10 号金桐西路 10 号远洋光华国际 AB 座 7 层 b 10 号线至金泰西照 B 出口）

This high-end travel concierge company with celebrity clientele offers creative day tours including a history-rich romp through the hutong, taking in the Drum Tower, a secret folk museum and the home of a champion trainer of fighting crickets. It also books tour guides and chauffeurs.
这家拥有名人客户的高端旅游礼宾公司提供富有创意的一日游，包括历史悠久的胡同嬉戏、参观鼓楼、秘密民俗博物馆和格斗蟋蟀冠军训练师的故乡。它还预订导游和司机。

2City Walk
Nanluogu Xiang Alleyway Ramble
2 City Walk 南螺崮巷漫步

START Nanluoguxiang subway station
开始南螺鼓巷地铁站

END Drum & Bell Towers
结束鼓楼和钟楼

LENGTH 2km; one hour
长度 2 公里;一小时

From exit E of Nanluoguxiang station, go north into the main alley then take the first right onto Chaodou Hutong (炒豆胡同). Starting at No 77, the next few courtyards once made up the 1former mansion of Seng Gelinqin, a Qing dynasty general. Note the enormous bǎogǔshí (drum stones) at the entranceway to No 77, followed by more impressive gateways at Nos 75, 69, 67 and 63. After No 53, turn left into an unmarked alleyway and follow it north to Banchang Hutong (板厂胡同).
从南螺鼓巷站 E 出口向北进入主巷，然后在第一个小巷右转进入炒豆胡同 。从 77 号开始，接下来的几个院落曾经组成 1 了清代将领僧格林沁的旧宅邸。请注意 77 号入口处巨大的鼓石，然后是 75、69、67 和 63 号更令人印象深刻的大门。过 53 号后，左转进入一条没有标记的小巷，然后沿着它向北行驶到板厂胡同 。

Heading left (west) to No 19, turn right through the unusual 2hallway gate – a rare connecting passageway leads all the way to Dongmianhua Hutong (东棉花胡同). Turn right on to the hutong, then left along an unnamed alley signposted to Penghao Theatre, a small arthouse theatre with a lovely cafe and tree-shaded roof terrace.
向左（西）行驶至 19 号，右转穿过不寻常 2 的走廊大门 ——一条罕见的连接通道一直通向东棉花胡同 。右转进入胡同 ，然后沿着一条标有澎湖剧院路标的无名小巷左转，这是一个小型艺术剧院，设有可爱的咖啡馆和绿树成荫的屋顶露台。

Emerge onto Beibingmasi Hutong (北兵马司胡同) and cross Nanluogu Xiang into historic 3Mao’er Hutong (帽儿胡同). Admire the grand old entranceways and if the gates are open, step into the charming courtyards at Nos 5 and 11. Further on, No 37 was the 4former home of Wan Rong, who would later marry China’s last emperor, Puyi.
驶上北兵马司胡同 ，穿过南罗古巷，进入历史悠久的 3 毛儿胡同 。欣赏宏伟的古老入口，如果大门打开，可以走进 5 号和 11 号迷人的庭院。再往前走，37 号是 4 万荣的故居 ，万荣后来嫁给了中国最后一位皇帝溥仪。

Next, turn right on Doujiao Hutong (豆角胡同), winding your way past Great Leap Brewing #6, Beijing’s first craft-beer bar, to Fangzhuanchang Hutong (方砖厂胡同), then Nanxiawazi Hutong (南下洼子胡同), and continue north to Gulou Dongdajie (鼓楼东大街). Turn left here and then, just before you reach the imperious red 5Drum Tower, make a right into Caochang Hutong (草厂胡同). Continue along the lane, then bear left as the hutong turns right. Follow this wonderfully winding alley to the back of the 6Bell Tower, then walk around the tower and head south to the 7Drum & Bell Square, a great spot for photos. If you’ve timed it just right, you can climb the Drum Tower to catch one of several daily drumming performances (the schedule is posted above the ticket office).
接下来，右转进入豆角胡同 ，蜿蜒经过北京第一家精酿啤酒吧 Great Leap Brewing #6，到达方砖厂胡同 ，然后是南下洼子胡同 ，然后继续向北行驶至鼓楼东大街 。在这里左转，然后在到达威严的红色 5 鼓楼之前，右转进入草厂胡同 。继续沿着车道行驶，然后在胡同右转时左转。沿着这条蜿蜒的小巷到达钟楼的 6 后面，然后绕着塔楼走，向南前往钟鼓广场 ， 7 这里是拍照的好地方。如果您时机恰到好处，您可以爬上鼓楼观看每日几场鼓乐表演之一（时间表张贴在售票处上方）。

4Sleeping
4 睡眠

If you’re able and willing to splurge, you’ll get a lot for your money in Beijing compared to other world capitals. Pickings are more slender at the bottom end, especially since the government’s bizarre ‘bunk-bed ban’ in 2018, but hunt around and you can still bag a bargain.
如果你有能力并且愿意挥霍，与世界其他首都相比，在北京你会得到很多东西。底端的采摘更加细长，尤其是自政府在 2018 年奇怪的“双层床禁令”以来，但四处寻找，你仍然可以买到便宜货。

Check out Drum Tower & Dongcheng North or Beihai Park & Xicheng North for cheaper courtyard hotels and hostels with those rustic hutong vibes.
查看鼓楼和东城北或北海公园和西城北，寻找具有质朴胡同氛围的廉价四合院酒店和旅馆。

HUTONG TOURS
胡同旅游

To delve deeper into the daily life of the hutong, sign up for a half-day tour with Beijing by Foot, The Hutong or Bespoke Travel Co..
要深入了解衚衕的日常生活，请报名参加北京步行 、胡同或定制旅游有限公司的半日游。

4Forbidden City & Dongcheng Central
4 故宫和东城中心

China Great Hall HotelHOTEL¥¥
中国大会堂酒店 HOTEL¥¥

(人民大会堂兵官, Rénmín Dàhuìtáng Bīngguān; map Google map; %010 6607 1188; www.chinagreathallhotel.com; 19 Xijiaomin Xiang, 西交民巷甲19号; Tian’anmen Sq viewing r ¥900; aiWs; bLine 2 to Qianmen, exit C, or Line 1 to Tian’anmen West, exit C)
（ 人民大会堂兵官 ，Rénmín Dàhuìtáng Bīngguān; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6607 1188;www.chinagreathallhotel.com;19 西交民巷甲 19 号 ;天安门广场观景 r ¥900; a i W s b 2 号线到前门，C 出口，或 1 号线到天安门西，C 出口）

A little-known oddity, this building beside the Great Hall of the People was strictly cadres only until it opened as a hotel in 2012. Functionally, it’s a stock Chinese business hotel, but the ‘Square Viewing Room’ category opens onto remarkable vistas of Tian’anmen Sq – you’ll pinch yourself when you draw back the curtains.
一个鲜为人知的奇怪之处，这座位于人民大会堂旁边的建筑在 2012 年作为酒店开业之前，才严格遵守干部。从功能上讲，这是一家普通的中国商务酒店，但“方形观景室”类别可以欣赏到天安门广场的壮丽景色——当你拉开窗帘时，你会捏住自己。

Geographically, it’s akin to staying in an annex of the Houses of Parliament, and it’s quite simply the closest digs to Tian’anmen Sq without pitching a tent next to Mao’s Mausoleum. Avoid the other room types – only the ‘Square Viewing Room’ is worthwhile. English is limited, and rooms are on the small side. The pool and gym occupy a windowless basement area.
从地理上看，它类似于住在国会大厦的附属建筑中，而且它只是距离天安门广场最近的挖掘地，无需在毛陵旁边搭帐篷。避免其他房型——只有“方形观景室”才值得。英语有限，房间偏小。游泳池和健身房占据了一个没有窗户的地下室区域。

Happy Dragon Alley HotelHOSTEL¥¥
快乐龙巷酒店 HOSTEL¥¥

(map Google map; %010 8400 2660; 78 Dongsi Jiutiao, 东四九条78号; r from ¥700; aW; bLine 5 to Zhangzizhonglu, exit C)
（ 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 8400 2660;东四九条 78 号东四九条 78 号 ;r ¥700 起; a W b 5 号线至张子中路，C 出口）

A former hostel turned mini-hotel (Beijing’s bunk-bed ban strikes again), Happy Dragon gets plaudits for its friendly staff and authentic alleyway location. The subway is a couple of minutes away on foot.
快乐龙是一家前旅馆，后来改建为迷你酒店（北京的双层床禁令再次出台），因其友好的员工和地道的小巷位置而广受赞誉。步行几分钟即可到达地铁。

Double Happiness CourtyardHOTEL¥¥¥
双喜庭院酒店 ¥¥¥

(北京阅微庄四合院宾馆, Běijīng Yuèwēi Zhuāng Sìhéyuàn Bīnguǎn; map Google map; %010 6400 7762; 37 Dongsi Sitiao, 东四四条37号; r from ¥1250; aW; bLine 5, 6 to Dongsi, exit B)

Service shines at this sprawling courtyard hotel on a lively hutong. Chinese-styled rooms are arranged on outdoor corridors, with hidden nooks to explore. It also has a bar, which is a rarity for a courtyard hotel.
这家位于热闹胡同上的广阔庭院酒店的服务大放异彩。中式客房布置在室外走廊上，有隐蔽的角落可供探索。它还设有酒吧，这在四合院酒店中是罕见的。

oCôté CourBOUTIQUE HOTEL¥¥¥
o 庭院侧 BOUTIQUE HOTEL¥¥¥

(北京演乐酒店, Běijīng Yǎnyuè Jiǔdiàn; map Google map; %010 6523 9598; www.hotelcotecourbj.com; 70 Yanyue Hutong, 演乐胡同70号; r from ¥1400; aiW; bLine 5 to Dengshikou, exit A, or Lines 5, 6 to Dongsi, exit C)

One of Beijing’s most charming courtyard hotels, Côté Cour makes for an exquisite getaway with its boutique-style guest rooms, magnolia-filled courtyard and beguiling period setting, on a hutong formerly home to imperial court musicians. Wangfujing is a 20-minute walk away.
Côté Cour 是北京最迷人的庭院酒店之一，位于曾经是宫廷音乐家的故居胡同上，拥有精品风格的客房、种满木兰的庭院和迷人的时代环境，是您一处精致的度假胜地。酒店距离王府井有 20 分钟的步行路程。

oMandarin Oriental WangfujingLUXURY HOTEL¥¥¥
o 王府井文华东方豪华酒店 ¥¥¥

(北京王府井文华东方酒店, Wángfǔjǐng Wénhuá Dōngfāng Jiǔdiàn; map Google map; %010 8509 8888; www.mandarinoriental.com; WF Central, 269 Wangfujing Dajie, 王府井大街269号王府中环; r from ¥3600; naW; bLine 1 to Wangfujing, exit C2)
（ 北京王府井文华东方酒店 ， Wángfǔjǐng Wénhuá Dōngfāng Jiǔdiàn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 8509 8888;www.mandarinoriental.com;WF Central， 269 Wangfujing Dajie， 王府井大街 269 号王府中环 ;r ¥3600 起; n a W b 1 号线至王府井，C2 出口）

Ten years in the making (the first MO burnt down in 2009), the Mandarin Oriental was worth the wait. Palatial rooms (at least 55 sq metres) have luxurious, fine-tuned details, from the ubertrendy ‘bowl’ bathtubs to the Dyson-branded hair dryers. ‘Mandarin Rooms’ frame a sensational panorama of the Forbidden City through floor-to-ceiling windows.
经过十年的制作（第一座 MO 于 2009 年被烧毁），文华东方酒店值得等待。富丽堂皇的客房（至少 55 平方米）拥有豪华、经过精心调校的细节，从超级时尚的“碗”浴缸到戴森品牌的吹风机。“文华房”透过落地窗勾勒出紫禁城的壮丽全景。

oPuXuan HotelLUXURY HOTEL¥¥¥
o 璞轩酒店豪华酒店 ¥¥¥

(璞瑄酒店, Púxuān Jiǔdiàn; map Google map; %010 5393 6688; https://thepuxuan.com; 1 Wangfujing Dajie, 王府井大街1号; r from ¥2900; naW; bLine 8 to National Art Museum, exit D2)

Opened in 2019, the PuXuan (sister hotel to Shanghai’s acclaimed Puli) is Beijing’s most stylish sanctuary, made for grown-ups who demand the finer things in life. Rooms are a masterclass of taste and design – choose a west-facing Grand Deluxe for artfully framed views of Jingshan Park, a sea of hutong and a tantalising corner of the Forbidden City.
璞轩酒店（上海著名的埔里酒店的姊妹酒店）于 2019 年开业，是北京最时尚的避难所，专为追求生活中美好事物的成年人而设计。客房是品味和设计的大师级客房 - 选择朝西的超豪华房，欣赏景山公园、 衚衕之海和紫禁城诱人角落的巧妙景观。

Beijing Hotel NUOHOTEL¥¥¥
北京宾馆诺宾馆¥¥¥¥

(北京饭店诺金, Běijīng Fàndiàn Nuò Jīn; map Google map; %010 6526 3388; www.nuohotel.com; 33 Dongchang’an Jie, 东长安街33号; r from ¥1400; naiWs; bLine 1 to Wangfujing, exit C1)
（ 北京饭店诺金 ， Běijīng Fàndiàn Nuò Jīn; 地图谷歌地图 ; % 010 6526 3388;www.nuohotel.com;东长安街 33 号东长安街 33 号 ;r ¥1400 起; n a i W s b 1 号线至王府井，C1 出口）

Formerly the Grand Hotel du Pekin (c 1917), this debonair old dame celebrates the golden age of travel in its showpiece marble staircase, glittering chandeliers and polished 1920s dance floor in the Writer’s Bar. Local operator NUO took over from Raffles in 2016, enhancing the food offerings but leaving the period features intact. Avoid the characterless newer wing at the rear.
这家温文尔雅的老太太前身是北京大酒店（约 1917 年），在其展示的大理石楼梯、闪闪发光的枝形吊灯和 Writer's Bar 的抛光 1920 年代舞池中庆祝旅行的黄金时代。当地运营商 NUO 于 2016 年接替了莱佛士，增强了食品供应，但保留了时代特色。避开后部毫无特色的新机翼。

It’s easily confused with NUO’s sister hotel (北京诺金酒店, Běijīng Nuò Jīn Jiǔdiàn; %010 5926 8888; 2A Jiangtai Lu, 将台路甲2号; d from ¥1240; paWs; bLine 14 to Jiangtai, Exit A) near the 798 Art District, so the check the address carefully.
它很容易与诺金的姊妹酒店 （ 北京诺金酒店 ，Běijīng Nuò Jīn Jiǔdiàn; % 010 5926 8888; 2A Jiangtai Lu， 将台路甲 2 号 ; d ¥1240 起; p a W s b 14 号线到江台，A）出口靠近 798 艺术区，所以要仔细核对地址。
